title: Part Time Tutor
company_info: Established since 2008, Nanyang has accumulated valuable experience that enables us to determine and focus on the best teaching methods. As a reliable and reputable education centre, we not only offer traditional teaching lessons tailored according to individual class type and workshop, we also provide a well- designed e-learning based platform to accommodate students of different interests and needs. Coupling with the latest technology platform in learning, we help to generate and retain the interest of our students and make learning an interesting journey for them. At Nanyang, we engage a panel of professional curriculum team to design and curate the teaching material for every lesson. Lessons are carefully crafted to ensure focus learning based on individual learning pace. Under our Tutors Mentoring Program, our tutors interact, coach and provide assistance to each student. We monitor and access each student’s performance periodically. We have since seen significant success and our students shown tremendous improvement in their subject learning and grades.

title: Agency Locum Phlebotomist (Part time and Full time)
company_info: About Us CareLink Home Nursing Services offers premier home-care services 24 hours a day, 365 days a year for those who need it. CareLink Home Nursing Services puts relationships first to support those giving care, to protect the dignity of those receiving it, and to enhance the quality of life for both seniors and their families.
employment_type: Contract, Part Time, Freelance, Full Time, Flexi-work
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for Locum Phlebotomist (Part time and Full time) to be outsourced to our clients from established private laboratories.
Responsible for the collection, handling and processing of blood specimens from patients as requested by the clinicians. Working in conjunction with the lab client service, dispatch section and technical staff to ensure total customer satisfaction.
Key accountabilities
Responsible for timely, accurate and sufficient collection of blood specimens from patients as requested by the clinicians using any one of the appropriate techniques as requested
Responsible for the inventory management of supplies utilised by the phlebotomy and other medical supplies stocked in the laboratory.
Required rotation of deployment between inpatient, outpatient clinic and medical centre.
Working alongside with laboratory client service staff and technical personnel to achieve total quality service and customer satisfaction.
Any other duties as assigned by the management from time to time.
Qualifications & Experience
Minimum GCE N Level, State Enrolled Nurse or equivalent or higher nursing qualifications, or Medical Technology degree/diploma with phlebotomist certificate.
Experience in phlebotomy skill performing vacutainer, syringe or butterfly needle venipuncture.
Good interpersonal skills.
Patient/customer service oriented.
All Interested candidates are invited to email your CV to: connect@carelink.sg or contact Sherry at 9841 0552

title: Administrative Assistant (Part Time)
company_info: Nanyang Psychology Academy is a specialized academy offering academic and skills based programmes in psychology and its related disciplines for learners from all walks of life.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, Education and Training, Events / Promotions
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the Company
Nanyang Psychology Academy Pte Ltd is a specialised training academy that offers diploma, advanced diploma, and specialist diploma qualifications focusing on psychology and related disciplines.
The training academy is looking for a motivated, disciplined, a detailed oriented, conscientious, and responsible individual to take on the administrative assistant (part time) role.

Work Arrangement
Start-up environment.
Approximately 20 hours a week.
Possibility of upgraded to full-time role.
Monday to Friday.
3pm to 7:30pm.
Main Duties and Responsibilities
· Contact person for assigned programmes to coordinate and ensure smooth delivery of all assigned programmes.
· Ensure course materials are made available in a timely manner.
· Provide prompt and accurate information and updates to students and relevant stakeholders.
· Supporting Lecturers on admin matters.
· Ensure valid student status and attendance for all current students.
· Release of Examination information to current students.
· Organize and conduct orientation for new students.
· Prepare and disseminate confirmed start classes / start term information.
· Work closely with GM to resolve student issues.
· Process re-enrolment, re-exam, deferments, extensions, exemptions, programme transfer, withdrawal.
· Monitor attendance of students, administer warning letters / exam barring letters and provide monthly reports.
· Conduct regular class visits to understand student’s needs; engagement with parents / guardians to update on students’ progress.
· Conduct module evaluation; focus groups; student surveys.
· Support student on student portal, LMS and any other student support management system.
· Update and maintain student data in the Academy’s data management system.
· Monitor student payment of course fees.
· Process student refunds.
· Prepare examination nominal roll for Exam Unit.
· Assist GM in the running of events.
· Any other ad-hoc duties as required by the company from time to time.

Requirements
· Diploma in any field with 1 - 3 years of experience preferred.
· Prior experience in Private / Education Industry is preferred.
· Meticulous and self-motivated with strong organisation skills.
· Possess good time management and administration skills.
· Able to work individually and as a team player with customer-oriented mindset and good communication skills.
· Able to work under pressure.
· Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.

Benefits
Basic + Commission + Incentives
Commission is uncapped

title: Full / Part time Veterinary Nurse
company_info: Westside Emergency is a 24/7 Veterinary Centre that provides round-the-clock emergency and critical care to small animal patients.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Due to an expanding caseload, Westside Emergency has full-time and part-time positions for VETERINARY emergency nurses to join our hard-working, close-knit team that is dedicated to the best possible patient outcomes.

The successful applicant will need to be available for day/evening and overnight shifts on a fortnightly roster in our 24/7 animal hospital.
About Westside
Westside Emergency is a 24-hour per day, 7 days a week, dedicated veterinary emergency and critical care (ECC) service. The hospital is staffed with an outstanding team of emergency veterinarians and nurses working together to provide evidence-based, gold-standard veterinary emergency and critical care. The culture of the team is one of teamwork, compassion, and growth. The management team focuses on staff well-being and prioritizes making shift work and veterinary ECC life sustainable and rewarding.


Westside Emergency is well equipped with digital radiology, ultrasound, endoscope, in-house laboratory, patient monitors, and sophisticated emergency and surgical facilities.
Our nursing team is highly valued and encouraged to utilize their skills and work autonomously to support our emergency veterinarians in providing exceptional patient care.

Role:
Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to;
Admission & triage of emergency patients
Forward planning and providing direct and individualized patient care for critically ill patients
Performing diagnostics and treatments
Plan and perform anesthesia for ill or unstable patients
Record all care information concisely and accurately
Work directly under the guidance and support of veterinarians and senior nurses
Liaise knowledgeably and accurately with staff and clients.
General Housekeeping
About you
We are searching for an experienced emergency nurse who possesses the ability to multitask and work well as a team in an often fast-paced environment. Referral hospital experience is preferable, but a strong general practice background is looked highly upon. On-the-job training will be provided with ongoing support by senior nurses and veterinarians however applicants must possess the ability to work unsupervised as well as demonstrate reasonable proficiency in basic nursing skills such as intravenous catheter placement, fluid therapy, drug dose calculations, use of monitoring equipment and assessing vital signs, as the role involves a degree of autonomy and use of initiative.

Essential Attributes
Minimum of 2 years’ full-time experience in veterinary general practice post-qualification is essential
Certificate IV or diploma in veterinary nursing or equivalent will be ideal
Singaporean/PRs only may apply due to MOM quota restrictions.
A professional and positive demeanor
Ability to work efficiently with initiative in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication skills
Well-developed organizational skills
Interest in emergency critical care medicine
Desirable attributes
Previous experience in an emergency or specialist VETERINARY hospital (but not essential)
Benefits
competitive salary package (commensurate with experience and availabilities for shifts)
travel allowance, OT and public holidays pay rates
Expand your clinical skills and knowledge in a supportive, exciting and dynamic environment
A challenging and rewarding position
In-house continuous education/ professional development/ Yearly CE budget for external education
Mentorship, job training and continuous workplace support
Staff discounts and social events
To apply, please send your updated resume to xiaojia@westsideemergency.com.sg

title: Part-time / Freelance Care Professionals (up to $22 / hr) Flexible working arrangement / Islandwide locations
company_info: Founded in 1994 in Omaha, USA, the Home Instead franchise network provides personalized care, support, and education to enhance the lives of ageing adults and their families. Today, the network is the world's leading provider of in-home care services for older adults, with more than 1,200 independently owned and operated franchises throughout the United States and 13 other countries. Home Instead, Inc. is a subsidiary of Honor Technology, Inc. Visit HomeInstead.com and joinhonor.com for more information. Local Home Instead franchise offices employ approximately 100,000 CAREGiversSM worldwide who provide relationship-based care services that enable older adults to live safely and comfortably in their own homes for as long as possible. The local offices partner with clients and their family members to help meet varied individual needs. In Singapore, Home Instead is independently owned and operated by Adventage Care Pte Ltd. Services span the care continuum – from providing personal care as well as nurse directed care and therapy services to specialized dementia care and hospice support. Visit HomeInstead.sg for more information. In addition to in-home care services, Adventage Care also provides a one-stop service for care products and equipment to support the continuum of care.
employment_type: Part Time, Freelance, Permanent, Full Time, Flexi-work
job_category: Medical / Therapy Services, Social Services, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Home Instead specialises in helping seniors who need care to continue living in their own home. We nurture professionals who have a passion for senior care in our community. As we grow our capacity to care, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our supportive team as a Care Professional. At Home Instead, we value individual skills and abilities.

GIVE YOUR PASSION A PURPOSE. Become a Home Instead Singapore Care Professional, assist seniors in our community and bring joy to their lives.
Do you have a passion for enhancing the lives of seniors? Are you looking to bring joy and dignity to the lives of those you help? Do you want to be part of a team that shares those same passions? Do you want to work for a home care provider who values your individual skills and abilities? Look no further, you are ‘Home’.
Home Instead Singapore is devoted to helping seniors who need care and nurturing those who want to help.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
We’re looking for self-motivated individuals with compassion and dedication to join our special team to personally provide the best quality in home care and support for our clients and their families. Caring for seniors is a labour of love that requires a special person and just the right touch. This can be a regular full-time or part-time role or an independent freelance contractor.

Your Responsibilities Would Include:
· Providing professional and culturally appropriate care and taking the lead to support seniors to live as independently as possible at home
· Tailoring individualised care to suit the personal needs of our individual clients
· Performing simple routine nursing procedures (for those with relevant experience)
· Ensure the safety and wellbeing of seniors
· Providing personal care to seniors, including assistance with Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
· Checking on vital signs and administering oral medication
· Maintaining clear and legible documentation and records
· Providing companionship, conversation, and emotional support
· Reminding and escorting to medical appointments and other social activities
· Non-specialist care activities when necessary

Skills & Qualifications
· Certification in professional caregiving, healthcare assistant or other relevant qualifications highly advantageous (training & OJT will be provided for those who do not have relevant qualification)
· Hands-on care experience especially caring for seniors a plus
· Good interpersonal skills and able to communicate effectively with seniors and their families
· Physically capable of transferring or assisting the senior’s mobility (ability to lift, pull or push)
· Read, write, and speak English
· Able to use simple MS Word for documentation

Who Should Apply?

We welcome:
- Current and Ex-staff nurses, enrolled nurses, nursing aide, healthcare aide, social workers and caregivers
- Homemakers, retirees, semi-retirees, and applicants with experience in caregiving for family members/relatives

Why Join Home Instead as a Care Professional?

- Flexible Work Arrangement – Choose your work schedule, let us know your availability and we plan your schedule based on your availability. DAY, NIGHT, OVERNIGHT AND WEEKEND SHIFTS are available

- Attractive Earnings - Earn competitive rates up to a maximum of $22/hour (depending on qualification, experience and shifts) for part-timers and freelancers. Part-timers are also ENTITLED to staff benefits, transport allowances and other generous incentives after probation

- Optimum Performance Environment- Get continuous training for best performance

- Insurance Coverage – Work with peace of mind

- Growth Opportunity - Grow professionally and earn more as you progress


Interested applicants please email your resumes in MS word/PDF to raymond.tan@homeinstead.sg


we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

company_info: Don Quijote, a Japanese discount retail chain famously known as “Donki”, is expanding to Southeast Asia as Don Don Donki. Don Quijote Group's holding company for overseas operations, Pan Pacific International Holdings Pte. Ltd. (PPIH) based in Singapore, will develop the Don Don Donki stores for Southeast Asia. To date, PPIH has opened two Don Don Donki stores in Singapore and Thailand will be open by end of 2018. PPIH targets to open at least 10 more stores by 2020. The Don Quijote Group was established in 1980 and opened its first Don Quijote general discount store in 1989. It has since steadily expanded its business and its network of stores by developing a unique type of business based on its store concept of providing “convenience,” “discount” and “amusement,” and by pursuing mergers and acquisitions.

title: Area Manager
company_info: YOSHINOYA is the oldest and largest chain of beef bowl restaurants with over 1200 outlets around the world. It was founded by Mr Eikichi Matsuda and named after his hometown in Yoshino-Cho, Osaka. The story of Yoshinoya began in 1899 with a small shop in Nihonbashi Fish Market selling Beef Bowl (or Gyūdon in Japanese). Its secret recipe broth seasoned with savoury herbs and spices together with large, sweet onions, served on a bowl of fluffy Japanese rice, presented a healthy and tasty meal to the fishermen and fish market mongers. Due to their busy and hectic schedules, the fishermen and fish market mongers barely had time to eat. At Yoshinoya, they could step into a bar-like area, place their order at the centre of the bar and receive their bowl soon after. Eating the beef bowl was very convenient as it could also be held in one hand and eaten whilst standing up. The word soon spread about Yoshinoya's beef bowl and it gained huge popularity among the working class. Over the years, Yoshinoya has rapidly expanded around the world, to various countries including Japan, USA, Hong Kong, China, Taiwan and Singapore. Yoshinoya Singapore was started in 1997 and has since grown from one outlet to 13 restaurant outlets and 1 foodcourt outlets island-wide.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Main Core Responsibilities
1)Met monthly HQ's sales budget for his/her assigned outlets.

3)Manage cost of good / operation cost.
4)Trainer and facilitator.
5)Ensure outlets and staff compliance company's SOP, code of conduct and regulation. 6)Outlets Hygiene to meet SFA guild line.
Intermediate Work (Middle Management Duties)
1. Able to plan daily/monthly sales target to meet HQ budget, regular follow up and update on sales performance with outlet in-charge.
2. Able to provide cost saving measurement for his/her area in-charge. Good understanding and knowledge on his/her outlet's past and present fast and slow moving items.
3. Able to interview staff in a professional manner and recommend for hiring. Retension rate for his/her area above than company's average.
4.Effectively manage and control Over-Time and Part-Time hour for his/her assigned outlet. Manage Labour cost within HQ budget.
5. Able to manage outlet schedule independently, re-deploy staff effectively and fast. Able to shift in (Cover shift) if needed.
6. Ensure outlet and staffs compliance with authorities regulation ( SFA licensing ) and abide to company's SOP, regulation and code of conduct.
Training Management
1.Able to provide training ,coaching and evaluation for the progress and performance for Manager / Supervisor / Staff .
2.Constantly giving ideas to upgrade and execute SOP and Operation issues when needed.
3.A good role model and show management by example for fellow colleagues.
Job Requirements and Expectation:
• Experiences: Minimum 3 years in same field
• Profession: Coversation and Basic PC skill
• Attitude: Positive and Willing to teach
• Capability: Leadership and Managing skill
• Personalities: Honest and Cheerful

title: Research Assistant (Centre for Life Sciences - Neurobiology Program)
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The National University of Singapore invites applications for research assistant position in the Polepalli lab at the Centre for Life Sciences - Neurobiology Program. Appointments will be made on a 1-yr contract basis, with the possibility of an extension.
Purpose of the post
The appointee will be a research assistant who will conduct research in neuroscience a focus on elucidating the synaptic and circuit mechanisms that mediate memory-guided behaviours. The appointee will be trained in the use of techniques including rodent behavioral assays, rodent surgeries, whole cell electrophysiology, and molecular biology tools including adeno-associated virus generation.
This position could potentially be converted to a part-time PhD position.
Qualifications
Main duties and responsibilities
We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated candidate who will be independent and will be involved in a multi-disciplinary project. They will be expected to perform rodent survival surgeries, molecular biology assays and rodent behaviour.
Qualifications
The applicant should:
Have a bachelor’s or a master’s degree (or expect to graduate in the next 2-3 months).
Have a proven track record of research (preferably in neuroscience, psychology or a related field)
Formal application: Please submit your application, indicating current/expected salary, supported by
1. CV (including personal particulars, academic and employment history, complete list of publications/oral presentations and full contacts of 3 referees), and
2. Cover letter with statement of interest


Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at our NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Part Time Freelance Delivery Driver
company_info: uParcel has planned, matched and optimised millions of same day deliveries using our proprietary logistics technology platform. Backed by data and driven by an innovative decentralised clustering model, we provide the most efficient deliveries to consumers through artificial intelligence assignment of delivery jobs to our network of delivery partners. In contrast to the traditional hub-and-spoke last mile delivery model, our point-to-point clustering model enable same day deliveries efficiently by removing the need for extensive packaging, warehouse sorting and reducing distance travelled for greater productivity. Our vision is to become the leading logistics platform that enables greater resource sharing and optimized routing to move the world more sustainably. We are currently present in Singapore and Malaysia, with expansion plans to the rest of the region.

title: Educational Therapist ( Full Time / Part Time)
company_info: EDUNAMICS PTE LTD an educational therapy company specialising in services that offer support and therapy for all educational and academic needs ranging from literacy and numeracy intervention, specialist support for children with learning difficulties (otherwise known as dyslexia, dyscalculia) and curriculum support. description:

Creating IEPs to target areas of weakness for student & progress reports.
Ability to arouse and sustain interest /involvement from children through varied activities.
Communication with parents.
Ability to participate in and contribute to multi-disciplinary assessment, planning, implementation, and evaluation process.
What We Offer:
A supportive and dynamic work environment that fosters growth and collaboration.
Competitive remuneration package with attractive benefits

Access to the latest AI tools and technologies to enhance productivity and client outcomes.

title: Fundraising Manager
company: ASIA RESEARCH AND ENGAGEMENT PTE. LTD.
company_info: ASIA RESEARCH AND ENGAGEMENT (ARE) ARE helps financial institutions, companies, and civil society organisations understand and communicate the financial relevance of the sustainability and governance issues that matter to them. ARE provides specialist research, consultancy and engagement services to help these organisations reach their goals.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description – Fundraising Manager
Full-time or Part-time
Location flexible – SE Asia networks essential
$7K to 9K plus bonus, negotiable and depending on experience

Asia Research and Engagement (ARE) brings the voice of investors to Asia’s sustainable development challenges. We run collaborative engagement programs across Asia, assembling coalitions of investors to address strategic sustainability issues and using dialogue and shareholder escalation tools to shift the mindsets of senior decision-makers across finance and industry.
ARE has a team of highly motivated professionals with a range of backgrounds and disciplines who help to drive change. Our activities include running investor-backed engagement programmes and producing high-grade research on sustainability themes and management by Asian listed companies.
Our main areas of expertise are energy transition and its financing, protein transition, and sustainable real estate. We target a range of sector related Asian companies and banks.
ARE is looking for someone to focus on designing, driving and delivering an effective fundraising strategy and activities. The role holder will work with the Managing Director, Program Directors and Communication team members.

Duties and Responsibilities:
· Design and deliver a fundraising strategy to grow and diversify revenue streams from philanthropic foundations, grants, high net worth individuals and our collaborating investors.
· Collaborate with the Managing Director and Program Directors to drive and support ongoing fundraising activities
· Ensure sustainability of relationships and inspirational stewardship with our network of existing investors and funders.
· Manage key streams of revenue for ARE’s Programs working with departmental budgets to achieve or exceed fundraising and growth targets, including forecasting, planning and pro-actively reporting on progress of achievements to stakeholders
· Plan a programme of fundraising and business development events in collaboration with the Communications Manager and Program teams
· Project manage the submission of fundraising grant pitches and proposals including leading writing of applications to foundations and other institutional funders, in collaboration with the Program Directors.
· Following up with targeted high net worth individuals, investors, family offices and foundations in and beyond Asia.

Requirements and competencies:
· Proven experience and raising revenue in fundraising with an existing established network
· Experience of producing and delivering pitches, applying for grants and ability to write persuasive funding applications
· A broad understanding of sustainability and climate contexts, or an ability to rapidly grasp Energy Transition, Protein Transition and other sustainability and environmental topics
· Bachelor’s degree and Master’s level education preferred
· Excellent communication, writing, organisational skills and attention to detail
· A genuine interest in Asia and sustainability, location flexible but Asia networks and working time zone essential

Benefits including CPF (Singapore) or pension contributions, discretionary bonus, 20 days annual leave, group medical insurance (Singapore), flexible working from home/office. Hybrid working arrangement if located in Singapore.

www.asiareengage.com

title: Home Care Professionals (up to $22 / hr) Flexible working arrangement / Islandwide locations
company_info: Founded in 1994 in Omaha, USA, the Home Instead franchise network provides personalized care, support, and education to enhance the lives of ageing adults and their families. Today, the network is the world's leading provider of in-home care services for older adults, with more than 1,200 independently owned and operated franchises throughout the United States and 13 other countries. Home Instead, Inc. is a subsidiary of Honor Technology, Inc. Visit HomeInstead.com and joinhonor.com for more information. Local Home Instead franchise offices employ approximately 100,000 CAREGiversSM worldwide who provide relationship-based care services that enable older adults to live safely and comfortably in their own homes for as long as possible. The local offices partner with clients and their family members to help meet varied individual needs. In Singapore, Home Instead is independently owned and operated by Adventage Care Pte Ltd. Services span the care continuum – from providing personal care as well as nurse directed care and therapy services to specialized dementia care and hospice support. Visit HomeInstead.sg for more information. In addition to in-home care services, Adventage Care also provides a one-stop service for care products and equipment to support the continuum of care.
employment_type: Part Time, Freelance, Permanent, Full Time, Flexi-work
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Home Instead specialises in helping seniors who need care to continue living in their own home. We nurture professionals who have a passion for senior care in our community. As we grow our capacity to care, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our supportive team as a Care Professional. At Home Instead, we value individual skills and abilities.

GIVE YOUR PASSION A PURPOSE. Become a Home Instead Singapore Care Professional, assist seniors in our community and bring joy to their lives.
Do you have a passion for enhancing the lives of seniors? Are you looking to bring joy and dignity to the lives of those you help? Do you want to be part of a team that shares those same passions? Do you want to work for a home care provider who values your individual skills and abilities? Look no further, you are ‘Home’.
Home Instead Singapore is devoted to helping seniors who need care and nurturing those who want to help.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
We’re looking for self-motivated individuals with compassion and dedication to join our special team to personally provide the best quality in home care and support for our clients and their families. Caring for seniors is a labour of love that requires a special person and just the right touch. This can be a regular full-time or part-time role or an independent freelance contractor.

Your Responsibilities Would Include:
· Providing professional and culturally appropriate care and taking the lead to support seniors to live as independently as possible at home
· Tailoring individualised care to suit the personal needs of our individual clients
· Performing simple routine nursing procedures (for those with relevant experience)
· Ensure the safety and wellbeing of seniors
· Providing personal care to seniors, including assistance with Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
· Checking on vital signs and administering oral medication
· Maintaining clear and legible documentation and records
· Providing companionship, conversation, and emotional support
· Reminding and escorting to medical appointments and other social activities
· Non-specialist care activities when necessary

Skills & Qualifications
· Certification in professional caregiving, healthcare assistant or other relevant qualifications highly advantageous (training & OJT will be provided for those who do not have relevant qualification)
· Hands-on care experience especially caring for seniors a plus
· Good interpersonal skills and able to communicate effectively with seniors and their families
· Physically capable of transferring or assisting the senior’s mobility (ability to lift, pull or push)
· Read, write, and speak English
· Able to use simple MS Word for documentation

Who Should Apply?

We welcome:
- Current and Ex-staff nurses, enrolled nurses, nursing aide, healthcare aide, social workers and caregivers
- Homemakers, retirees, semi-retirees, and applicants with experience in caregiving for family members/relatives

Why Join Home Instead as a Care Professional?

- Flexible Work Arrangement – Choose your work schedule, let us know your availability and we plan your schedule based on your availability. DAY, NIGHT, OVERNIGHT AND WEEKEND SHIFTS are available

- Attractive Earnings - Earn competitive rates up to a maximum of $22/hour (depending on qualification, experience and shifts) for part-timers and freelancers. Part-timers are also ENTITLED to staff benefits, transport allowances and other generous incentives after probation

- Optimum Performance Environment- Get continuous training for best performance

- Insurance Coverage – Work with peace of mind

- Growth Opportunity - Grow professionally and earn more as you progress


Interested applicants please email your resumes in MS word/PDF to raymond.tan@homeinstead.sg


we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

title: Spanish Language Teacher
company_info: English Explorer as one of the premium English Language school in Singapore that offers a structured English program. Using Syllabus from Oxford University Press, which is affiliated with the University of Oxford and local English syllabus from Singapore MOE. Our English tutors are CELTA and TESOL certified to deliver the course. Our classroom English learning with enhance your English skills faster than studying alone or practising with friends. Only through quality training, we build your foundation knowledge and the correct use of Grammar and Vocabulary so that you can have a competitive edge in your work or study. We also provide English courses for children or kids’ learning especially for local and international learners to fit different school curriculum. A variety of these English language courses includes Basic English for Kids, PSLE English, GCE O level English & A level English, TOEFL and IELTS course. Children can start learning English with us as young as three years old all the way to high school or University. Studying English with your guide in English Explorer now and get ready for your journey to success Visit our website to find out more ~ www.englishexplorer.com.sg Take Free Online English Test Now ~ https://www.englishexplorer.com.sg/english-trial-class/ Training Centre: 137 Cecil Street level 7, Hengda Building, Singapore 069537. Tel: 65191865 WhatsApp: 90662798 info@englishexplorer.com.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Spanish Explorer is looking for a passionate and experienced Part-time Spanish Teacher to teach physical face-to-face classes in Singapore.
~ Candidates who are not physically in Singapore will not be considered

We are one of the premium Spanish Language schools in Singapore that offers a structured language program using a DELE-accredited syllabus from Spain.

Our teachers are certified to teach Spanish as a foreign language. Our Spanish courses will enhance students' language skills faster than studying alone or practising with friends.
Join our teaching team now!

Responsibilities:
To deliver Spanish language classes according to our materials and syllabus.
Maintain Japanese language teaching of the highest quality.
To provide both Private and Group Teaching at the client’s place or in the school
To provide professional learning advice to both adults and kids students
Requirements:
Applicants must be willing to work in Singapore with some travelling required
Lessons will be either at our School or the client's place in Singapore
Local Experienced Teachers are most welcome to apply (Expatriates in Singapore)
An experienced teacher who has taught this language before is a good requirement.
Applicants good to have at least DELE C1 certification
Unable to apply for Work Pass in Singapore as this position is only for part-time
Send your resume to info at spanishexplorer.com.sg or apply through Indeed

Thank you and hope to hear from you soon

137 Cecil Street level 7 Singapore (069537)
www.spanishexplorer.com.sg

title: English Teacher (Part-time Specialist English and Writing Teacher)
company: WRITE EDGE LEARNING CENTRE (BC) PTE. LTD.
company_info: At Write Edge, we specialise in providing high-quality English and Writing tuition classes for Primary and Secondary school students in Singapore. The English enrichment centre was founded in 2014 with a vision to deliver exceptionally effective lessons that help to build a strong foundation in the English language and nurture writing skills in young students. From just 12 students and 1 branch in Lorong Ah Soo, Singapore, Write Edge has since expanded to 7 physical branches,1 online arm called WELearn and also offer online classes to students in Malaysia. With decades of combined teaching, curriculum and education management experience, we’ve got a well-seasoned team at the helm. We work very hard to help our students have the best experience at Write Edge and take great pride in what we do. Our Vision: To be Singapore's Leading English and Writing Enrichment Specialist Our Mission: To make the Mastery of English and Writing possible for every student http://write-edge.com/careers instagram.com/writeedgecareers/
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Are you passionate about English and want to explore a career in education? If the answer is YES then WE want you!

Write Edge is looking for like-minded people to join us as a Part-Time Specialist English and Writing Teacher across all our physical locations in Singapore!

As a Specialist English and Writing Teacher, you will
Teach classes with small class sizes of up to 8 students, based on our materials.
Each class duration is 2 hours.
We are looking for educators who:
Can communicate in English proficiently
Scored a minimum of B3 for English Language O Levels / A Levels
We are only looking for candidates familiar with the Singapore curriculum and assessment systems. We will provide you with the training and teaching materials.

Location(s): Across Branches
Please see the list of locations at https://www.write-edge.com/locate-us/

Work Hours:
Flexible Schedule
Take 4 or more classes between:
Weekdays: 1pm - 10pm
Weekend: 830am - 630pm
Read more about how it is like to work at Write Edge here: https://tinyurl.com/WEglassdoor

title: Supervisor
company_info: IDEA MANAGEMENT SERVICES PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
To perform supervisor duties and work at non-aircon working environment.
Responsibilities
- Assist the management on daily operational matters
- Provide customer service and attend to customer enquiry
- Arrangement of maintenance schedule for equipment and perform routine inspection
- On site troubleshooting including service standard & technical issues for different type of appliance to ensure operations to be smooth & productive
- To conduct assessor role at confined space as and when required
- Needs to work on standby mode (company mobile SIM card will be provided) to attend any emergency situation, especially after midnight
- Coordinate with suppliers on stock ordering & delivery
- Guide part-time staffs on stock arrangement and replenishment
- May be required to hand carry up to 25 kg
- Other ad hoc duties assigned by the management
Requirements
- Related experience in any industry, preferable with service or maintenance experience.
- Able to get along with team members with lower education
- Needs to work under stress and tight schedule
- Able to work on rotating shift: 9am to 5pm or 2pm to 10pm daily
- OT may be required with short notice to cover other colleagues’ MC or leaves
- Able to work in a Non-Aircon environment
- Working location may subject to change with short notice and only public transportation expenses can be reimbursed

title: Assistant Pastry Chef
company_info: Our Stinky Journey begins in Fook Gor Durian Farm - A 27 acre family owned durian farm located in Raub district, Pahang, Malaysia, Fook Gor Durian Farm was started in 1982 by Chan Lai Fook. It is home to Malaysia's oldest Musang King tree. During every durian season, fresh durians are picked daily from 5am to 7am. They are sorted and graded. The best ones are sent directly to Singapore to our very own retail outlet, 99 Old Trees, located in Owen Road, Singapore. The STINKY'S brand is managed under 99 Old Trees. Excess durians will be sent daily to our processing plant, located just 5 minutes away from the farm, for pulp extraction. These extracted pulp is meticulously graded by hand. They are spread across a white acrylic surface to be checked for impurities and tough fibrous pieces. Pulp that is of poor quality are painstakingly removed by hand and discarded. It's a very labour intensive process. What's left behind is a batch of high quality, strong smelling pulp! And that is why in every bite of our dessert, you'll be hit by the full strength of Musang King's flavour! Our hip new cafe just opened at 1 Teo Hong Road, 088321, a stones throw away from Outram MRT, Exit 4
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights
Work Life Balance
R&D Budget
Career Progression

Roles & Responsibilities:

• Follow staff duty roster and job assignment where required
• Comfortable working with the "KING OF FRUITS"
• Adhere to the company’s standards in food hygiene and safety practices in the kitchen area
• Assist in the preparation and production of the company’s products (baking and decorating of cupcakes, whole cakes and/or cookies, tarts, choux pastry preparation of ingredients, setting up of baking utensils and equipment, & packing the products for delivery)
• Maintain a proper food costing on all merchandise utilized to minimize food wastage
• Check all 'mis-en-plus' and quality of merchandise prepared in the bakery room
• Ensure proper storage of all perishable material accordingly to the First-in-First-Out Policy
• Other ad-hoc duties as assigned

• Candidate must possess at least a Diploma or Certificate in Pastry and Baking

title: Intern - Research & Engagement
company_info: ABOUT STEWARDSHIP ASIA CENTRE: SAC is a non-profit organisation established by Temasek, dedicated to helping business and government leaders, investors and individuals activate stewardship practices through research, executive education and engagement. We define stewardship as the mindset and practice of creating value by integrating the needs of stakeholders, society, future generations and the environment.
job_category: Events / Promotions, Marketing / Public Relations, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We seek a positively driven, sharp, and self-motivated individual with a strong interest in researching to promote practical stewardship applications through executive education, research, and engagement. An intern in this position will be supporting key initiatives, such as Steward Leadership 25, an annual listing of the 25 best projects of steward leadership excellence within the Asia-Pacific region, and other research projects that may arise. This includes conducting relevant research to accelerate the stewardship movement for investors, senior business leaders, HR professionals, and Board Directors.

Responsibilities
Research, analysis, and programme review, including:
Conduct landscape research and literature review of relevant topic areas related to steward leadership and its application, e.g., investment, sustainability, data stewardship, and governance.
Curate and write case studies on projects that have made the Steward Leadership 25 List
Contribute to generating content ideas to meet research and engagement objectives.
Support in the content development of events and other activities, such as executive education programs
Assist in other administrative and research development duties as needed
Requirements
Undergraduate (3rd or 4th year students) or Postgraduate students from a relevant field such as Social Science, Business Administration, Corporate Sustainability, or Sustainable Development are preferred.
Ability to identify the range of pertinent and applicable business challenges and opportunities
Willing to work on all sorts of assignments, including supporting the organization of events and some administrative work
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including editing and proofreading
Good team player yet able to work well independently
Meticulous, analytical, highly organized, and intellectually inquisitive
Ideally, the candidate can commit for 3 – 6 months (flexible with possible part-time arrangement).
Interested candidates are to send their resumes to: adelinefoo@stewardshipasia.com.sg. Shortlisted candidates will be invited for interview.

title: Assistant Community Care Coordinator (Code: HJNA)
company_info: PeopleSolve is an international search firm recruiting experienced and qualified nurses from around the world. Our program is specifically designed to help Singapore & internationally educated nurses succeed permanently in our strategic partner's healthcare organizations in Singapore and beyond. Since 2021, we have helped 6,000 ++ nurses, healthcare assistants and patient service officers to secure placements in key healthcare locations including hospitals, clinics, community care centres, testing and vaccination centres since 2021. We are a member of the Raffles Medical Group, a leading medical group and the largest private group practice in Singapore, PeopleSolve is committed to adopting fair and merit-based employment practices towards our candidates detailed under Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices ("TGFEP"). We comply with the applicable labour and employment laws and similar laws in Singapore. Our Five (5) Principles of Fair Employment Practices adopted are: (1) Recruit based on Merit (2) Respect candidates (3) Provide fair opportunities (4) Reward fairly (5) Comply with labour laws EA License No: 21C0695
job_category: Environment / Health, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Be part of team to look after the care needs of people.

Who We are

PeopleSolve is an international search firm recruiting experienced and qualified nurses from around the world. Our program is specifically designed to help Singapore & internationally educated nurses succeed permanently in our strategic partners healthcare organizations in Singapore and beyond.

Since our beginning in 2021, we have helped 6,000 + nurses and healthcare professionals, both full time and part time, to secure placements in key healthcare locations including hospitals, clinics, community care centers, testing and vaccination centers.

At PeopleSolve, we specialize in recruitment and outsourcing solutions for the healthcare industry.

What We Offer
An opportunity to touch the life of others, and make a difference in them.
An opportunity to work in one of the Singapore's best public health systems.
Up to 3 months of training, including shadow senior healthcare professionals for their daily work.
Highly competitive compensation package.

About the Role
Work closely with the Care Coordinator Team to provide basic care coordination, discharge planning, monitor/evaluate and education for patients.
Conduct telephone follow up to build rapport, obtain feedback and engage patients and their caregivers.
Support caregivers in caring for patients.
Promote healthy lifestyle education, including educating the carers of the patients.
Participate in community health lifestyle activities.
What We Are Looking For
Candidate must possess at least a Diploma
Diploma in the following discipline will be helpful, include: Diploma in Health Management & Promotion, Diploma in Community Development and Diploma in Social Science)
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Team player and someone who wants to contribute towards community services
Proficient in computer skills and Microsoft office
Able to work independently and with a team
May need to work on weekend for community activities
Work Location
Singapore

title: Executive (Finance Department) [NIE]
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
address: NIE Admin Block, Level 2, Blk 1, 1 Nanyang Walk 637616
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
ABOUT THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF EDUCATION (NIE)
The National Institute of Education (NIE), Singapore, is Singapore’s national teacher education institute and we are proud to be an integral part of the nation’s education service. We play a key role in the preparation of teachers and in the provision of teacher professional and school leadership development programmes. We are committed to our vision of being An Institute of Distinction: Leading the Future of Education and our mission to Inspire Learning, Transform Teaching and Advance Research. Read more about NIE here.
The National Institute of Education invites suitable candidates for the position of Executive with the Finance Department.
Executive (Finance Department) [NIE]
Responsibilities
As part of a team which handles payroll and claims for the Institute, your responsibilities will entail the following:
· Handle monthly payroll processing, including statutory contributions and tax filing for part-time lecturers.
· Assist with payroll-related payments to full-time staff, including resignation payments, education allowances and other miscellaneous payments.
· Collation and submission of claims for government-paid leave.
· Process overseas travel and online/local conference claims using SAP Concur.
· Attending to accounting matters for conferences and restricted funds.
· Computation of liquidated damages for Staff Development Scheme.
· Assist in adhoc areas from time to time.
Requirements
· A Polytechnic Diploma preferably in Accountancy or its equivalent.
· Preferably 1 to 2 years of working experience in handling payroll.
· Organized and meticulous in handling numbers and data.
· A team player with good working attitude and is willing to learn and adapt.
· Proficient in Microsoft Office applications especially Excel.
· Experience in SAP would be an added advantage.
· Familiar with the local employment guidelines eg Employment Act, CPF regulations and Income Tax requirements.
Closing Date
The closing date of the advertisement is 5 October 2023.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Other Information
NIE staff can take chartered buses at their own expense from or near their homes to NIE campus. This is subject to the availability of seats.

title: SALES ASSISTANT
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary:

We are seeking a motivated and outgoing Sales Assistant to join our team at Bored Go Here. As a Sales Assistant, you will play a key role in attracting crowds to our establishment, engaging with potential customers, and promoting our products and services. Your enthusiasm and dedication will contribute to creating a welcoming and exciting atmosphere for our customers.


Responsibilities:

1. Attract and Engage Customers: Proactively approach and attract customers to the Bored Go Here establishment. Engage them in conversations about our products and services to spark interest and encourage sales.
2. Product Knowledge: Develop a comprehensive understanding of the products and services offered by Bored Go Here. Be able to articulate their features, benefits, and unique selling points to potential customers.
3. Sales and Promotion: Utilize effective sales techniques to encourage customers to make purchases and upsell additional products or services when appropriate. Assist in promotional events and special offers to drive sales.
4. Customer Service: Deliver exceptional customer service to ensure a positive and memorable experience for every customer. Address customer inquiries, provide product information, and handle complaints or issues professionally and promptly.
5. Maintain Store Appearance: Ensure the store is clean, organized, and visually appealing at all times. Assist in arranging displays and merchandise to maximize attractiveness and visibility.
6. Team Collaboration: Work closely with the Bored Go Here team to achieve sales targets and company objectives. Collaborate with colleagues to create a cohesive and supportive work environment.
7. Commitment and Reliability: Demonstrate a strong commitment to the role and adhere to the scheduled working hours diligently. Punctuality and reliability are essential for the success of this position.


Requirements:

- Previous experience in sales, customer service, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory. Art skills will be an added advantage.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage effectively with customers and team members.
- A positive and enthusiastic attitude with a passion for promoting products and attracting crowds.
- Strong work ethic and willingness to commit to the part-time schedule.
- Ability to work weekends and extended hours during peak periods or special events.
- High school diploma or equivalent education is required.
- Must be legally eligible to work in Singapore.


To Apply:
If you are excited about working in a dynamic and fun environment where you can showcase your sales skills, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter to boredgohere@gmail.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Description
Provide assessment/evaluation and implement intervention for individuals diagnosed with Autism aged 7‐18 years old and aged 18‐55 years old
Perform centre‐wide screening to determine therapy service necessity, utilising methods such as conducting screening tools, interview, document review, direct observations, and case deliberation meetings with teachers, coaches, co‐therapists, and department head to provide timely and quality therapy services to our beneficiaries.

Provide home instruction program, actual demonstration of OT treatment/handling procedures to teachers, coaches, parents, and caregivers for the continuity of OT management in the classroom and at home
Responsible for providing training for the staff and parents/caregiver of students/clients under the program
Responsible for conducting self‐regulating strategies to achieve individual/students' maximum level of arousal necessary for learning
Perform documentations such as OT initial evaluation, Individualized Education Plan (IEP), progress reports, OT notes, task analysis reports, and discharge planning
Serve as on‐site clinical supervisor overseeing occupational therapy interns
Job Requirements:
Possess at least a degree in Occupational Therapy
Valid Full AHPC (Singapore) registration
Practical experience with persons with autism spectrum disorder and their families is an asset

EHS Executive| Plant Operation Safety | Chemical Industry | MHS | Tuas

Job description
To lead in the overall Plant Operation Safety matters, EHS training, reviewing Safe Work Procedures and Incident Investigation.
Mentor multiple operational departments in the Functional EHS Management program. Implement EHS Management System and Risk Management (RM) plans within EMM operation and non-operation scope
Conduct daily walk about and rectify any safety hazard that is found within the premises.
Construct and circulate weekly EHS Tool Box Meeting Topics for the company.
Train, co-ordinate and supervise the Company Emergency Response Team for the premises in first-aid, firefighting and evacuation in the event of fire or other related emergencies.
Organize campaigns, training courses and other activities which will develop and maintain the EHS awareness of the employee.

Prepare technical sales support materials
Project Planning: Collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and internal teams to understand the project requirements, objectives, and scope. Develop detailed project plans, including system design, equipment selection, installation methodology, and timelines.
Installation Oversight: Supervise the installation and commissioning of CCTV systems. Ensure that installation practices adhere to industry standards, safety regulations, and best practices.
Testing and Troubleshooting: Conduct system testing to verify functionality and performance. Troubleshoot technical issues and work with the installation team to resolve any problems that arise during the implementation phase.

Proficient in system administration, configuration, and troubleshooting.

The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The National Institute of Education (Nanyang Technological University, Singapore) invite suitable applications for the position of Research Assistant (part-time) 12 months contract at the Office of Education Research at the Centre for Research in Child Development (CRCD), Office of Education Research (OER).

Project Title: NeuroEducation Program for Parents

Project Introduction:
NeuroEducation Program for Parents is an arm of a larger research program titled LOVING (Learning about Our behavior is Valuable for Increasing Nurturing relationships and healthy Growth), which goal is to examine the impact of improving caregiver sensitivity. NeuroEducation Program for Parents focuses on educating parents about relations between brain development in early life and cognitive performance and behavior across the lifespan. NeuroEducation will comprise a core education package based on neuropsychology and inquiry-based pedagogy. Sessions will include lectures, labs based on active learning, and readings customized to caregivers.

Requirements
Academic qualification:
Bachelor degree in Education and/or Psychology and/or Neuroscience or similar areas
Work experience:
Prior experience conducting systematic literature reviews
Prior experience designing and developing learning materials
Prior experience teaching at any educational level
Prior experience designing and administering instruments to evaluate learning goals
Prior experience designing interview protocols
Prior experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis
Prior experience disseminating research findings targeting the general public and academic audiences
Desirable interests, skills, and attributes:
Passion for teaching and learning
Interest in effective learning in Higher Education settings
Prior experience in inquiry-based pedagogy
Have good communication and organizational skills
Have good interpersonal skills
Be a good team-player, proactive, and able to work independently and with a large group of researchers
Responsibilities
To conduct systematic literature reviews (summarizing, coding, and organizing relevant literature).
To design and develop learning materials for the program including topics such as general characteristics of the nervous system and core aspects of brain development and brain anatomy.
To support the delivery of the program.
To design and administer instruments to evaluate the program learning goals by assessing pre-and post- knowledge concerning brain and cognitive development, for example.
To design semi-structured interview protocols and conduct qualitative analysis (summarizing, coding, and organizing relevant literature).
To compute different statistical analyses for the findings obtained in the systematic literature reviews and semi-structured interviews.
To contribute to research translation and dissemination of findings targeting the general public and academic audiences.
To perform other tasks as required by the Principal Investigators.
Application
Applicants (external and internal) will apply via Workday. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Workday Job Requistion ID: R00014915
(https://ntu.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers/job/NTU-Main-Campus-Singapore/Research-Assistant--Centre-for-Research-in-Child-Development--Office-of-Education-Research---NIE-_R00014915-1)

Closing Date
Closing date for advertisements will be set to 14 calendar days from date of posting.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
System Engineer | Security Tech Engineer | Bugis

Working Day: Mon to Fri
Working Hours: 9:30am - 6:30pm
Location: North Bridge Rd - Bugis
Salary: $4500 - $6000

Responsibilities:
Provide pre-sales engineering and support
Prepare technical sales support materials
Project Planning: Collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and internal teams to understand the project requirements, objectives, and scope. Develop detailed project plans, including system design, equipment selection, installation methodology, and timelines.
Installation Oversight: Supervise the installation and commissioning of CCTV systems. Ensure that installation practices adhere to industry standards, safety regulations, and best practices.
Testing and Troubleshooting: Conduct system testing to verify functionality and performance. Troubleshoot technical issues and work with the installation team to resolve any problems that arise during the implementation phase.
Client Communication: Act as the primary point of contact for clients during the project, providing regular updates on progress, addressing concerns, and managing expectations.
Design, deploy, and manage physical security systems, including access control and video surveillance solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and provide technical expertise in designing and implementing physical security solutions.
Configure and integrate security systems, such as Lenel OnGuard access control system and Milestone VMS, to meet project requirements.
Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in physical security systems, access control, and video surveillance.
Collaborate with vendors and suppliers to evaluate and select appropriate hardware and software solutions.
Prepare and maintain system documentation, including system configurations, diagrams, and procedures.
Conduct training sessions for end-users on the operation and maintenance of physical security systems.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining physical security systems.
Installation and configuration experience with CCTV cameras, NVRs/DVRs, switches, and related equipment.
Integration of CCTV systems with access control or alarm systems to provide comprehensive security solutions.
Proficiency in configuring video management software (VMS) and network settings for seamless camera monitoring, recording, and retrieval.
Understanding of TCP/IP, network structure, firewalls, LAN, and VLAN.
Familiarity with other physical security technologies, such as intrusion detection systems and intercom systems, is a plus.
Proficient in system administration, configuration, and troubleshooting.
Knowledge of industry standards and best practices related to physical security systems, access control, and video surveillance.
Experience such as Lenel OnGuard access control system, Milestone VMS, and other Video Management Systems (VMS) is a big plus

Supreme Full Jobs List

title: Part-time / Freelance Care Professionals (up to $22 / hr) Flexible working arrangement / Islandwide locations
company_info: Founded in 1994 in Omaha, USA, the Home Instead franchise network provides personalized care, support, and education to enhance the lives of ageing adults and their families. Today, the network is the world's leading provider of in-home care services for older adults, with more than 1,200 independently owned and operated franchises throughout the United States and 13 other countries. Home Instead, Inc. is a subsidiary of Honor Technology, Inc. Visit HomeInstead.com and joinhonor.com for more information. Local Home Instead franchise offices employ approximately 100,000 CAREGiversSM worldwide who provide relationship-based care services that enable older adults to live safely and comfortably in their own homes for as long as possible. The local offices partner with clients and their family members to help meet varied individual needs. In Singapore, Home Instead is independently owned and operated by Adventage Care Pte Ltd. Services span the care continuum – from providing personal care as well as nurse directed care and therapy services to specialized dementia care and hospice support. Visit HomeInstead.sg for more information. In addition to in-home care services, Adventage Care also provides a one-stop service for care products and equipment to support the continuum of care.
employment_type: Part Time, Freelance, Permanent, Full Time, Flexi-work
job_category: Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services, Personal Care / Beauty, Social Services, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Home Instead specialises in helping seniors who need care to continue living in their own home. We nurture professionals who have a passion for senior care in our community. As we grow our capacity to care, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our supportive team as a Care Professional. At Home Instead, we value individual skills and abilities.

GIVE YOUR PASSION A PURPOSE. Become a Home Instead Singapore Care Professional, assist seniors in our community and bring joy to their lives.
Do you have a passion for enhancing the lives of seniors? Are you looking to bring joy and dignity to the lives of those you help? Do you want to be part of a team that shares those same passions? Do you want to work for a home care provider who values your individual skills and abilities? Look no further, you are ‘Home’.
Home Instead Singapore is devoted to helping seniors who need care and nurturing those who want to help.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
We’re looking for self-motivated individuals with compassion and dedication to join our special team to personally provide the best quality in home care and support for our clients and their families. Caring for seniors is a labour of love that requires a special person and just the right touch. This can be a regular full-time or part-time role or an independent freelance contractor.

Your Responsibilities Would Include:
· Providing professional and culturally appropriate care and taking the lead to support seniors to live as independently as possible at home
· Tailoring individualised care to suit the personal needs of our individual clients
· Performing simple routine nursing procedures (for those with relevant experience)
· Ensure the safety and wellbeing of seniors
· Providing personal care to seniors, including assistance with Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
· Checking on vital signs and administering oral medication
· Maintaining clear and legible documentation and records
· Providing companionship, conversation, and emotional support
· Reminding and escorting to medical appointments and other social activities
· Non-specialist care activities when necessary

Skills & Qualifications
· Certification in professional caregiving, healthcare assistant or other relevant qualifications highly advantageous (training & OJT will be provided for those who do not have relevant qualification)
· Hands-on care experience especially caring for seniors a plus
· Good interpersonal skills and able to communicate effectively with seniors and their families
· Physically capable of transferring or assisting the senior’s mobility (ability to lift, pull or push)
· Read, write, and speak English
· Able to use simple MS Word for documentation

Who Should Apply?

We welcome:
- Current and Ex-staff nurses, enrolled nurses, nursing aide, healthcare aide, social workers and caregivers
- Homemakers, retirees, semi-retirees, and applicants with experience in caregiving for family members/relatives

Why Join Home Instead as a Care Professional?

- Flexible Work Arrangement – Choose your work schedule, let us know your availability and we plan your schedule based on your availability. DAY, NIGHT, OVERNIGHT AND WEEKEND SHIFTS are available

- Attractive Earnings - Earn competitive rates up to a maximum of $22/hour (depending on qualification, experience and shifts) for part-timers and freelancers. Part-timers are also ENTITLED to staff benefits, transport allowances and other generous incentives after probation

- Optimum Performance Environment- Get continuous training for best performance

- Insurance Coverage – Work with peace of mind

- Growth Opportunity - Grow professionally and earn more as you progress


Interested applicants please email your resumes in MS word/PDF to raymond.tan@homeinstead.sg


we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

title: TCM Physican 中医师
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Environment / Health, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services, Personal Care / Beauty
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Salary Range
Full Time : $2500 - $7000
Part Time : Hourly Rate $10.00 - $20.00

Job Description
· Conduct routine check-ups to patients to assess their health condition and discover possible issues
· Give appropriate advice for healthy habits (diet, hygiene etc.) and preventative actions to promote overall health
· Conduct examinations to ill patients and evaluate symptoms to determine their condition
· Ask intuitive questions to discover causes of illness
· Reach an informed diagnosis based on scientific knowledge and the patient’s medical history
· Prescribe and interpret lab tests to obtain more information for underlying infections or abnormalities
· Prescribe medications or drugs and provide comprehensive instructions for administration
· Collaborate with other physicians and physician assistants to form a high-performing medical team
· Examine and provide treatments for injuries and refer patients to other physicians when needed (ophthalmologists, orthopedists, neurologists etc.)
· Keep records of patients’ diseases, operations or other significant information (e.g. allergic episodes)
· Cultivate a climate of trust and compassion for patients
· Remain up-to-speed with developments and best practices in medicine by attending conferences and seminars

Job Requirements
- Full-Time/Permanent Position
- Must have full registration with Singapore College of TCM and at least a TCM
diploma cert
- Must be able to communicate with English & Chinese speaking customers (to provide consultation and recommend suitable treatments to English and Chinese speaking customers.)
- Able to commit to working retail hours on weekdays (10.45am-9pm) and weekends/public holidays (9.45am-6pm)
- Good customer service
- Interpersonal skills

Staff Benefits
- Attractive salary scheme
- Meal and transport allowance provided
- Yearly performance bonus
- Medical benefit scheme
- Workers’ insurance
- Long service award
- Different types of leave benefits
- Career progression & development opportunities
- Comfortable and conducive working environment

工资范围
全职：$2500 - $7000
兼职：每小时收费 $10.00 - $20.00

工作责任
• 对患病者进行检查并评估症状以确定他们的健康状况并发现可能存在的问题
• 就健康习惯（饮食、卫生等）和预防措施提供适当的建议，以促进整体健康
• 提出问题以发现疾病的原因
• 根据科学知识和患者的病史做出明智的诊断
• 替病患做实验室测试以获得更多有关潜在感染或异常的信息
• 开药方或药物并提供全面的管理说明
• 与其他医生和医生助理合作，组成一支高绩效的医疗团队
• 检查受伤情况并提供治疗，并在需要时将患者转诊给其他医生（眼科医生、骨科医生、
神经科医生等）
• 全面的记录患者疾病、手术或其他重要信息（例如过敏事件）并为患者保密
• 培养对患者的信任和同情的氛围
• 通过参加会议和研讨会紧跟医学发展

工作要求
- 全职/永久职位
- 必须在新加坡中医学院有完整注册并至少拥有中医高专文凭证书（TCM Diploma）
- 必须能够与说英语和华语的客户沟通（为说英语和华语的客户提供咨询和推荐合适的治疗方法）
- 能够接受在零售时间上班，周日（上午 10点45分至晚上 9 点）、周末和公共假期（上午
9 点45分至下午 6 点）
- 良好的客户服务
- 人际交社能力

员工福利
- 底薪加高佣金
- 提供膳食和交通津贴
- 年度绩效奖金
- 医疗福利
- 工人保险
- 长期服务奖
- 不同类型的休假福利
- 职业发展和个人发展机会
- 舒适和优越的工作环境

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Title: Part-Time Warehouse Assistant
Location: East-Central Region
Position Type: Part-Time (3-4 working days a week)
Hours: 5-6 hours per day
We are seeking a dedicated Part-Time Warehouse Assistant to join our team. This position is crucial to ensuring our stocks transfers are done in a efficient manner.

Responsibilities:
Receive and inspect incoming shipments of beverages and snacks.
Safely transport and store inventory within the warehouse.
Prepare and package products for delivery to vending machine locations.
Maintain accurate records of inventory levels.
Conduct regular inventory checks to ensure stock levels are sufficient.
Assist in loading and unloading delivery vehicles.
Maintain a clean and organized warehouse environment.
Adhere to safety guidelines and company policies.
Qualifications/ Requirements:
Physically fit and capable of lifting and carrying up to 1-2 cartons of drinks at once.
Previous warehouse or inventory management experience is a plus.
Attention to detail and accuracy in inventory tracking.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong organizational skills.
Reliable and punctual.
Basic computer skills.
Working Hours:
This is a part-time position with flexible working hours. The warehouse operates 3-4 days a week, and the assistant will work 5-6 hours per day.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and a brief cover letter outlining their qualifications and availability.

Full-time office hours will be 9.30am - 6.30pm and part-time working hours will be 1 - 6pm.

title: Education Consultant
company_info: Spring College International (SCI) was established in 2001. We are registered with Singapore’s Committee for Private Education (CPE) and awarded with 4-years Edutrust Certificate. We have two campuses with the main campus located at Jurong East and branch campus at Bishan. SCI provides a full range of education courses and services to suit all the individuals’ needs, which include Language Courses, Preparatory Course, Diploma & Advanced Diploma courses, Holiday Courses, Corporate Language Training, Tuition and Enrichment courses, Education services, Overseas Internship and International Exchanges services. Our self-study trip is one of the popular programmes which is highly recommended among international students. Students can enjoy a special vacation in Singapore, broaden their view and strengthen intercultural exchanges at the same time. Apart from providing full-time courses for the international students, we also provide part-time courses for local students such as communication and professional language courses as well as customized training programs for companies to meet the ever-growing needs of our customers. Here at SCI, we adopt an interactive and group-style teaching approach incorporated with multimedia teaching aids to capture students’ interest. SCI uses an advanced learning management system where students and parents can monitor their learning progress anytime, anywhere. We believe in providing a holistic education and are concerned about our students’ growth by instilling the right values to them. We organize extra curriculum activities such as environmental protection and care for the elderly events for our students annually.

title: Dental Nurse / Assistant

job_category: Customer Service, Environment / Health, Medical / Therapy Services, Professional Services, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Are you seeking work-life balance, and keen on developing a fruitful career in a job which also rewards your dental health?

We seek someone responsible who is a team player yet able to work individually, to join our diverse multi-lingual committed team and commit to the equivalent of 3.5 days every week, on a permanent part-time basis. $15 an hour. On-job training provided.

A dental assistant must be able to stand and learn hands-on chairside duties and procedures to assist the pracitioner, while also learning reception-related duties seated at the counter. Sterilisation and infection control measures are also taught. Procedures include scaling and polishing, denture-related stages and mouthguards, fillings, extractions, plus crowns or bridges.

Just across the road, from Clementi Mall. Medical and dental benefits. Performance bonus and other personalised benefits will also be discussed, depending on the resume of the candidate.

company_info: VIPSHOP (NYSE: VIPS) is an e-commerce platform established in 2008. It is a leading online discount retailer for brands in China that offers high quality and popular branded products to consumers throughout China at a significant discount to retail prices. In 2021, VIPSHOP reached a 117Billion RMB ($18.4Billion USD) of Net Revenue. Since its IPO on 2012 on NYSE, VIPSHOP has realized profitability for 39 consecutive quarters. VIPSHOP has also been awarded “2022 Forbes China Best Employer of the Year”, “2022 Most Sustainable Employer”. It has also been included in the "Fortune China 500" and "China's Top 500 Private Enterprises" list for many times. VIPSHOP has now expanded to Southeast Asia, with the aim to connect the world’s top brands to Southeast Asia consumers – Exceptional Brands, Accessible Prices.

title: Cake Baker (Full-time / Part-time)
company_info: Home of low carb and keto. Kekito Bakery produces the lowest-carb cakes, bread and desserts. Helmed by award-winnning head baker. Kekito Bakery was started in 2019 to serve the low carb and keto community. Keki means cake in Japanese and keto is the type of cakes we do. We do not use flour or sugar in our cakes, yet they tastes as good as normal bakes. Our Japanese-inspired bakes allow ketogenics to enjoy desserts that are delicate and delicious. We use premium ingredients including almond flour and natural sugar substitutes. Using Japanese flavours, ingredients and high-skilled baking techniques, bakers who develop their career with us will be trained in higher level baking techniques that can also be used for normal bakes. Our specialities include cheesecakes, cotton cakes, and gluten-free breads. We are now based at Everton Park, a short walk from Outram Mrt Station. Kekito Bakery is always on the look out for passionate bakers who want to develop their skills in producing top quality Keto bakes with Japanese cake making techniques.
