title: Trainer (Woodworking / Carpentry )
company_info: Melbourne International School (MIS) caters for a range of children with special needs. It is for students from 3 years of age through to 18 years. Using the Visual and Performing Arts Programme to meet the individual learning needs of our students. This child-centred approach is where our teachers use the power of concrete experiences mediated through dance, drama, music and visual arts as a way to immerse our students in a deeply engaging learning environment. This approach enables us to achieve literacy, numeracy and living skill goals to further facilitate each student’s development more readily. The individual needs of our students informed the construction of the programme and this curriculum model. To ensure the successful implementation of the Visual and Performing Art Programme in the classroom, we have a teacher and a teacher’s assistant who work closely together to address the daily needs of students. This team-based approach to learning underpins our approach to providing many services for our students. MIS also supports its students with a range of services delivered by our therapy team. This includes specially qualified members of staff such as an Art Therapist, Music Therapist, Occupational Therapist and Speech and Language Therapist with access to a Physiotherapist and Drama Therapist when needed. These staff members closely work and plan alongside our teaching staff to deliver services in line with what is known as an integrated services delivery model. This we believe is a very powerful way to address the highly individualised needs of our students. In such a model highly experienced and dedicated professionals plan the appropriate strategies to support each student according to their needs. There is an exceptional level of commitment and passion displayed by our members of staff in continually seeking to improve the quality of our services available to our students.

company: FISH INTERNATIONAL SOURCING HOUSE PTE. LTD.
company_info: FISH INTERNATIONAL SOURCING HOUSE PTE LTD is an international seafood company established in 2004. We specialize in the manufacturing, distribution, import and export of high-quality deep-frozen seafood products. We trade worldwide over 40 countries. Our company is expanding into food manufacturing and cold storage in Singapore. We are constructing a modern and automated value-added seafood processing hub to support Singapore’s 2030 vision. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Prepare workstations at the start of processing & clean and reinstate workstations after processing.
Handle frozen/chilled fish/seafood processing by types of equipment with various components including processing (cutting, trimming, deboning & deskinning etc), packing (vacuum packing & strapping etc ) and storing of products
Cleaning and maintaining tools and equipment
Ensure that all food hygiene and safety standards are met and keep up to date with industry standards
Perform other food manufacturing duties assigned by the supervisor, as needed
Requirement:
Able to work in a cold environment, comfortable with repetitive work activities, working in accordance with schedules, operating machinery and working with cold materials.
Training will be provided to applicants with little to no experience in operating processing types of equipment.
Ability to stand or walk for extended periods and lift heavy items.
Responsible, punctual, good working attitude, good team player and able to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision
Applicants with WSQ certification in basic food hygiene, and familiar with food handling and handling process in fish have added advantages.
Applicants must be willing to work OT duties including weekends and public holidays when required.

Job Highlights
Job Types: Permanent, Part-time.
Working Hours: Mon to Fri 7.45 am to 4.45 pm, Sat 7.45 am to 11.45 am. (5.5 days)

title: Waiter & Waitress
company_info: Take a plunge into Singapore’s most unique dining experience, an intriguing new world of mystery and sensation you have never experienced before. Join us on a culinary journey through taste, smell, touch and sound, in total darkness. Seated in our pitch-black dining room, you will enjoy an exquisite mystery tasting menu of 12 beautiful dishes, crafted from the finest ingredients by our Chef de Cuisine and his team. Enhance your experience with an additional wine or cocktail tasting to go along with your meal. Our blind and visually impaired hosts who have been specially trained to offer guidance and reassurance to sighted guests will be taking care of you throughout your dinner. It is truly a human experience when the roles are reversed and the blind become your eyes, opening your mind to a deeper consciousness. This affinity leads to mutual trust and respect, and a realization of the value of their work and overall ability to carry out tasks. This makes NOX – Dine in the Dark to more than just a dining experience, it is a unique mind-altering sensory experience. Definitely a treat for special occasions!
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The award-winning NOX- Dine in the Dark is one of Singapore's most unique restaurants with a stellar 10-year track record by introducing you to a new world of mystery and sensation you have never experienced before through a culinary journey through taste, smell, touch, and sound, in total darkness.

We are currently on the lookout for Part-time Waiters and Waitresses!

They will be responsible to:
· To greet and seat guests upon arrival and whenever the possible to greet guests by names.
· Provide high-quality customer service in accordance with company standards to ensure consistent execution of service standards.
· To be always alert, attentive, and always assume a pleasing and helpful attitude towards guests and colleagues.
· Assist team members and managers in ensuring efficient daily operations.
· Collect valuable feedback from guest regarding our food and drinks to enhance our service.
· Maintain high standards of cleanliness and hygiene throughout the establishment.
· Any other duties assigned by superiors from time to time.

Requirements:
· While prior experience is not mandatory, basic customer service experience is advantageous.
· Availability for shifts, weekends, and public holidays is essential.
· Proficient communication skills in English to effectively interact with customers.
· Strong service-oriented mindset, with a positive attitude and ability to work well in a team.

They can expect a competitive salary package of up to $15.00 per hour that commensurate with relevant experience!

Please feel free to contact christopher@noxdineinthedark.comfor further information.

title: Content Creation & Social Media Management Intern
company_info: VIPSHOP (NYSE: VIPS) is an e-commerce platform established in 2008. It is a leading online discount retailer for brands in China that offers high quality and popular branded products to consumers throughout China at a significant discount to retail prices. In 2021, VIPSHOP reached a 117Billion RMB ($18.4Billion USD) of Net Revenue. Since its IPO on 2012 on NYSE, VIPSHOP has realized profitability for 39 consecutive quarters. VIPSHOP has also been awarded “2022 Forbes China Best Employer of the Year”, “2022 Most Sustainable Employer”. It has also been included in the "Fortune China 500" and "China's Top 500 Private Enterprises" list for many times. VIPSHOP has now expanded to Southeast Asia, with the aim to connect the world’s top brands to Southeast Asia consumers – Exceptional Brands, Accessible Prices.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Develop and create high-quality content for our website and social media platforms, including articles, graphics and videos.
Writing, editing and publishing engaging content for various social networks, including Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, Linkedin, TikTok.
Assist with social media management, including creating and scheduling posts, monitoring social media channels and engaging with followers.
Schedule and execute content, maintain social media calendar across digital channels.
Optimise social media posts (language, tone, message) based on our target audience's behaviors.
Analyse social media metrics to measure the success of our campaigns and make recommendations for improvement.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in content creation and social media management.

Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications or a related field.
Passionate in community building, social media marketing, creator management or similar role.
Familiarity with social media platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram.
Knowledge of social media analytics tools and metrics.
Strong writing and editing skills, with an eye for detail and accuracy.
Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks.
Creative mindset and ability to think outside the box.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Highly organized, able to manage projects, meet deadlines and drive projects forward.
Conversational in speaking and writing Mandarin in order to liaise with Chinese-speaking counterparts in HQ.
Ability to balance multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about e-commerce startups and lifestyle topics (beauty, skincare, fashion, sports, household).

Roles & Responsibilities
We are now seeking motivated and enthusiastic individuals to join our team as a Part-Time Swimming Coach. Job Descriptions:

Nearby MRT

title: Retail Associate (Full-Time)
company_info: PPP Coffee aspires to be an organisation that reflects the close communities that our product brings together and serves. We believe that in addition to hiring the right talent, having the right values and mindsets, can lead the organisation in the right direction for specialty coffee. PPP Coffee’s employees for that matter, are the driving force of the organisation. Our business exists with the following in mind : offering a product or solution, running operations and consolidating our financial position. Yet, this is always underpinned by its people and technology. While coffee as a crop and commodity remains the same, the perception of what coffee can be, has been and will continue to be evolving. We're looking for people who bring fresh ideas from all areas, and work with a collaborative mindset in achieving a collective effort. Whatever your position here, we seek your contribution in taking the initiative and speaking out. PPP Coffee will always be a coffee company at heart. We hire a diverse range of people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to make however small a difference, in the world of specialty coffee. With coffee being pervasive in all cultures, countries, languages, social classes - we seek to bring communities closer together, by connecting people with coffee. While we aim to make better coffee, we also aim to make coffee better.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job description
As a Retail Associate, you will be part of the exciting and new omni-channel retail team, representing PPP Coffee on the frontline to advance our mission in connecting people with coffee. You will oversee PPP Coffee's retail concept store and will be responsible for being the bridge between the product team and the coffee community by providing recommendations for both homebrewers and baristas from our range of coffee and equipment.

Job Description
Oversee the day-to-day operations of the retail outlet(s) by PPP Coffee in Singapore
Lead and manage a team of full-time and part-time Retail Associates
Responsible for maintain the look-and-feel of the shop through visual merchandising and daily housekeeping
Ensure a high standard of service is provided in the store at all times
Conduct and follow up on requests for in-store demos, events and/or workshops
Handle all customer queries and feedback in a professional and timely manner
Participate in regular product trainings and/or workshops
Track, monitor and maintain store inventory and ensure accuracy in monthly stock take
Prepare and submit daily and monthly closing sales reports and timesheets
Minimum Requirements
Able to speak fluent English and/or communicate confidently with a diverse group of people
5-day work week including weekends and public holidays
Service oriented and a team player
Additional Employee Benefits
Birthday Leave + Annual Leave (starting from 14 days)
Sick Leave + Medical consultation reimbursement
Staff Meal upon completion of Full Shift
Complimentary non-alcoholic drinks
Family & friends discount on food & beverage

title: Student Care Teacher - Senior / Junior
company_info: Established since 2015, PlayFACTO School is a premium education centre providing student care services and children enrichment. Through teaching valuable life skills, PlayFACTO School provides its students with an increased capacity to learn effectively, as well as offering them a strong foundation for life-long learning.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PlayFACTO @ CCK is looking for experienced and passionate Student Care Teachers to join our team! Positions are available immediatly for the right candidates.

PlayFACTO School is the leading student care provider in positive holistic education and after school care for students of P1-P6.

As a Student Care Teacher with PlayFACTO, you will help develop student’s hearts and minds using our unique positive education framework, daily enrichment programmes, and guided assistance of each student's Primary homework assignments.

If you are a passionate educator looking for a fun and engaging environment where you can help your Primary students develop high calibre character and educational foundations for their future, we'd like to hear from you!

Come JOIN US and make difference in student’s lives at PlayFACTO @ CCK

Roles and Responsibility (Student Care Teacher)
Delivery and presentation of lesson content to children
Supervision of primary school children (primary 1 to 6) to ensure completion of daily homework
Ensure safety and timely transfer of children from school to student centre when/where required
Ensure safety and wellbeing of children at all times
Regularly communicate with parents and guardians regarding children’s progress and behaviour
Fetching of students from nearby schools when/where required
Administrative work (sales, collection of fees, and collection of forms) and upkeep of centre premises.
Any other ad-hoc duties as delegated by Centre Head

Requirements (Student Care Teacher)
Minimum 1-2 years of experience in education/student care/classroom experience, preferably at the primary level
Preference given to candidates with Professional Certificate/NiTEC/Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in Linguistics/Languages, Education/Teaching/Training or equivalent
Able to guide students in primary school subjects
Possess excellent work ethic and professional integrity
Exhibit a positive attitude when faced with challenges
Love children and the learning process
Possess a passion for working with and nurturing children
Benefits (Student Care Teacher):
Competitive salary commensurate to each teacher’s eudcational/professional qualifications, experience, dedication, and skill in the classroom
Flexible worrking arrangemtns - Full Time, Part Time, and Relief positions available.
Growth opportunities
Full academic/operational training provided
Yearly internal Professional Development courses and opportunities for external Professional Development
A happy and positive work environment!
Does PlayFACTO sound like a good fit for you?

Please apply here or send your resume via WhatsApp to 8683 0566 or to choachukang@playfactoschool.com.sg

Please include in your resume your educational background, your work history, details of your last work experience and 1 referee that can provide a review of your previous job performance.

Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified for interview.

title: Part-time / Freelance Care Professionals (up to $22 / hr) Flexible working arrangement / Islandwide location
company_info: Founded in 1994 in Omaha, USA, the Home Instead franchise network provides personalized care, support, and education to enhance the lives of ageing adults and their families. Today, the network is the world's leading provider of in-home care services for older adults, with more than 1,200 independently owned and operated franchises throughout the United States and 13 other countries. Home Instead, Inc. is a subsidiary of Honor Technology, Inc. Visit HomeInstead.com and joinhonor.com for more information. Local Home Instead franchise offices employ approximately 100,000 CAREGiversSM worldwide who provide relationship-based care services that enable older adults to live safely and comfortably in their own homes for as long as possible. The local offices partner with clients and their family members to help meet varied individual needs. In Singapore, Home Instead is independently owned and operated by Adventage Care Pte Ltd. Services span the care continuum – from providing personal care as well as nurse directed care and therapy services to specialized dementia care and hospice support. Visit HomeInstead.sg for more information. In addition to in-home care services, Adventage Care also provides a one-stop service for care products and equipment to support the continuum of care.
employment_type: Part Time, Freelance, Permanent, Full Time, Flexi-work
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Home Instead specialises in helping seniors who need care to continue living in their own home. We nurture professionals who have a passion for senior care in our community. As we grow our capacity to care, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our supportive team as a Care Professional. At Home Instead, we value individual skills and abilities.

GIVE YOUR PASSION A PURPOSE. Become a Home Instead Singapore Care Professional, assist seniors in our community and bring joy to their lives.
Do you have a passion for enhancing the lives of seniors? Are you looking to bring joy and dignity to the lives of those you help? Do you want to be part of a team that shares those same passions? Do you want to work for a home care provider who values your individual skills and abilities? Look no further, you are ‘Home’.
Home Instead Singapore is devoted to helping seniors who need care and nurturing those who want to help.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
We’re looking for self-motivated individuals with compassion and dedication to join our special team to personally provide the best quality in home care and support for our clients and their families. Caring for seniors is a labour of love that requires a special person and just the right touch. This can be a regular full-time or part-time role or an independent freelance contractor.

Your Responsibilities Would Include:
· Providing professional and culturally appropriate care and taking the lead to support seniors to live as independently as possible at home
· Tailoring individualised care to suit the personal needs of our individual clients
· Performing simple routine nursing procedures (for those with relevant experience)
· Ensure the safety and wellbeing of seniors
· Providing personal care to seniors, including assistance with Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
· Checking on vital signs and administering oral medication
· Maintaining clear and legible documentation and records
· Providing companionship, conversation, and emotional support
· Reminding and escorting to medical appointments and other social activities
· Non-specialist care activities when necessary

Skills & Qualifications
· Certification in professional caregiving, healthcare assistant or other relevant qualifications highly advantageous (training & OJT will be provided for those who do not have relevant qualification)
· Hands-on care experience especially caring for seniors a plus
· Good interpersonal skills and able to communicate effectively with seniors and their families
· Physically capable of transferring or assisting the senior’s mobility (ability to lift, pull or push)
· Read, write, and speak English
· Able to use simple MS Word for documentation

Who Should Apply?

We welcome:
- Current and Ex-staff nurses, enrolled nurses, nursing aide, healthcare aide, social workers and caregivers
- Homemakers, retirees, semi-retirees, and applicants with experience in caregiving for family members/relatives

Why Join Home Instead as a Care Professional?

- Flexible Work Arrangement – Choose your work schedule, let us know your availability and we plan your schedule based on your availability. DAY, NIGHT, OVERNIGHT AND WEEKEND SHIFTS are available

- Attractive Earnings - Earn competitive rates up to a maximum of $22/hour (depending on qualification, experience and shifts) for part-timers and freelancers. Part-timers are also ENTITLED to staff benefits, transport allowances and other generous incentives after probation

- Optimum Performance Environment- Get continuous training for best performance

- Insurance Coverage – Work with peace of mind

- Growth Opportunity - Grow professionally and earn more as you progress


Interested applicants please email your resumes in MS word/PDF to raymond.tan@homeinstead.sg


we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

title: Talent Success & HR Manager
company_info: iDA'SG is now known as World Mode Singapore. World Mode Singapore is a specialist retail consultancy with end-to-end integrated solutions for retail professionals and retail clients. We are a wholly-owned subsidiary of World Mode Holdings Co. Ltd, a Japanese retail consultancy with a strong track record and largest market share of recruiting retail professionals for Japan's Beauty and Fashion industries. We meet each talent personally to assess their skill sets and understand their career interests before matching the right talents to the clients. Pursuing beyond the capabilities of a recruitment agency, we offer specially curated training programmes for talents to enhance their skills through blended learning. We offer total human resource services solution that includes: Permanent Placement Temp/Contract Placement Outsourcing Placement Bulk/Mass Hiring Projects Training Consultation Work Pass/Payroll Services Our mission is to fulfil the career dreams of individuals; believing happy retail professionals bring about happy shoppers and happy retail businesses. We have 23 offices in Japan and in 5 countries (Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, Taiwan and Australia).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Welcome to World Mode Singapore, where we pride ourselves on being a subsidiary of World Mode Holdings Co. Ltd, a Japanese retail consultancy renowned for its strong track record and dominant market share.

About Us:
At World Mode Singapore, we are a specialized retail consultancy, offering end-to-end integrated retail solutions to the Beauty and Fashion industries. As a fast-expanding player in the region, we are committed to driving excellence in the retail sector. Our core business vision revolves around elevating retail professionals and empowering them to thrive in their careers.

Why Work With Us:
Comprehensive Training Programs: We go beyond traditional talent placements and invest in our retail talents' growth through specially curated training programs. Blending learning methodologies, our training equips retail professionals with the skills they need to excel in their roles.

Enterprise-Grade Solutions:
World Mode Singapore offers value-added, top-tier solutions in Visual Merchandising, Marketing, Operations, and Technology for the Retail Industry. With our expertise, businesses can achieve peak performance and stay ahead in the competitive market. Innovative Approach: Our commitment to innovation drives us to constantly explore new strategies and cutting-edge technologies. We believe in pushing the boundaries of retail excellence and providing our clients with the most advanced solutions available.

Our Mission:
At the heart of our mission is the desire to fulfill the career dreams of individuals. We firmly believe that happy retail professionals lead to happy shoppers and successful retail businesses. By fostering a supportive and empowering work environment, we strive to create a team that is passionate, driven, and enthusiastic about shaping the future of retail in Asia-Pacific.

Join Our Team:
Are you ready to be part of a dynamic and innovative retail consultancy that is making waves in the Asia-Pacific market? If you are a dynamic individual seeking a challenging yet rewarding career in the retail industry, World Mode Singapore welcomes you with open arms. Together, we can make a significant impact on the retail landscape and shape the future of the industry. Join us now and embark on an exciting journey with World Mode Singapore as we redefine retail excellence in Asia-Pacific!

Main Purpose of the Job:
As our Assistant Manager in Talent Success and HR Ops, your responsibilities are to champion success by meeting hiring requirements of Clients, provide strong matching of career aspirations for jobseekers for retail industry and also support HR administration for all outsourced, temporary and part-timers.

Talent Success
• Support in data mining, getting leads, identifying opportunities and recommending services to meet client’s needs
• Generate and develop new clients by making cold calls/and generating leads independently (F2F visit or phone), professional networking
• Own the sales cycle from lead generation to closure
• Identifying key decision makers and leverage opportunities to promote and cross sell our services
• Negotiate agreement terms with clients to fulfil company’s objectives and sales goals
• Sharing of market insights and tabulate monthly sales report with the team
• Work in conjunction with other Talent Consultants and Training Team • Able to support sales presentations and build good relationships with Clients and Talents
• Support event planning, meeting strict deadlines and budget demands
• Support collaborations and partnerships with schools, external vendors, suppliers etc.

HR Administration
Provide support on the full spectrum of HR activities for field teams such as:
• Collating of timesheets from Part-Time Staff and tabulating the hours accordingly and compliance with statutory requirements including CPF, Maternity Claim, Childcare Claim, NS Claim and Tax Filing
• Liaise closely with clients in all HR related matters
• Prepare payroll summary for submission for payroll processing
• Onboarding and Offboarding for all new joiners
• Administer HR-related process which includes preparation of employment contracts, application and renewal of work passes for staff, confirmation of employees, administration of leaves etc.
• Updating and maintaining Employee Handbook, Safety Measurements SOP etc.
• Keep up to date on government grants, HR systems etc. and propose according to business needs
• Source and co-ordinate training courses, application of SDF fundings, update and maintain training records
• Maintain confidentiality and privacy of any personal and sensitive date • Any other HR-related duties as assigned

Job Requirements & Person Specification
(Qualifications, Experience, Skills & Behaviours)

We are looking for highly motivated, self-driven and creative individuals and team players with an entrepreneurial mindset. Keeping abreast of marketing trends, new technologies, emerging digital tools and platforms, and share insights with the rest of the team.
• Diploma in Sales, Marketing, HR or equivalent
• CEI Licensed
• Strategic and Analytical Thinker, Team Player
• Result oriented and Sales driven with the ability to cope with challenges
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Able to work independently and collectively as a team

If you are keen with the role, please reach out to Marilyn at: marilyn-lai@worldmode.com

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Student and Academic Services Officer (Academic)
Working Time: Monday to Friday, 8.30am – 6pm
Working Location: Haw Par Villa (Nearest MRT)
Salary: $3000 - $3800

Overview and Objective of the Position
The Student and Academic Services Officer is responsible for providing high quality administrative and services support, across a broad range of academic and student services and administrative functions.
The position acknowledges the interdependence of student and academic related matters, the importance of front of counter student facing activities and back of office administration, as well as the need for areas of specialisation.
Job Duties:

Academic Staff
Prepare and maintain sessional academic staff employment contracts.
Organise and maintain academic staff contact details, network accounts and systems access.
Ensure academic staff have access to required equipment and resources.
Obtain necessary teaching approval for academic staff.
Maintain records of qualifications and CVs of academic staff.
Register academic staff details through online systems to maintain CPE registration of academic staff.
Check sessional academic staff teaching claims for submission to Finance for processing.
Assist in planning and organising Professional Development workshops for academic staff.
Students Management
Manage students’ record and update students’ status on Student Management systems to ensure accuracy of record and academic status.
Advise students on course requirements.
Assist with enrolment of new and continuing students.
Provide support and assist students with academic enquiries.
Identify students in need of academic skills support and refer them to relevant support class.
Monitor academic progress to identify students at risk.
Process course variation applications and provide relevant academic counselling to students relating to the study plan.
Organise and conduct student academic advising session and briefing when required.
Ensure student academic progress is in accordance with regulations.
Provide support at Student Connect.
Students’ Contracts and Student’s Pass Management
Process student pass renewal application and student pass cancellation for each study period on SOLAR+
Monitor the validity and expiry of student passes and other types of passes for non-citizens
Maintain records of the application, payment, approval and collection of student pass
Ensure all student pass changes have relevant approvals in line with policy
Maintain procedures manual for the management of student pass
Assisting with the preparation and checking of student contracts
Execute student contracts in accordance with the procedures and in line with policy
Course Planning and Delivery
Assist in planning of units offering for each study period for all programs.
Manage and update student study plans each study period for all programs.
Assist in the development of the academic timetable for each study period in consultation with Director of Academic Services and academic staff.
Prepare timetable in the Student Management System and setup for students’ class registration.
Manage students’ class registration via the Student Management System.
Support the class monitoring process to ensure they are taking place in accordance with the timetable and keep records of any changes.
Ensure that the class sizes are viable after enrolment is finalised.
Support academic staff for course delivery requirement.
Support lesson observation as part of quality management.
Assist in planning and organising Study Skills workshops for students.
Maintain up to date knowledge of course structures and academic policies and procedures.
Attendance System Management
Manage the attendance system and liaise with the vendor to ensure the system is operating effectively.
Ensure that information (e.g. student enrolment and timetable details) on the attendance system is up to date and accurate.
Monitor the captured attendance records and review the accuracy of the data captured against scheduled timetable.
Prepare relevant reports from attendance records to facilitate the monitoring of attendance requirements, including identifying students at risk.
Prepare student attendance records for submission to Immigration & Checkpoints Authority for the purpose of Student’s Pass applications.
Process students’ absence justification requests and lecturers’ manual attendance requests.
Process attendance appeals.
Coordinate and facilitate staff training sessions on the attendance system.
Coordinate and facilitate the capturing of students’ bio data.
Academic Support
Meet and provide counselling with students who do not meet attendance requirements.
Provide support and assist students with academic enquiries.
Provide support at Student Connect.
Prepare the daily classroom schedules on the display monitors and maintain the locations where classroom schedules are displayed.
Support academic staff for course delivery requirement.
Assist in preparation of class lists.
Manage students and teaching staff surveys including the creation of the surveys, results compilation and analysis.
Assist with the logistics of tests and examinations.
Assist with the logistics for enrolment period.
Assist with preparation of Student ID cards.
Process and prepare students’ letter requests.
Others
Plan and implement student and academic staff surveys.
Prepare and analyze academic data and reports for Management.
Ad-hoc tasks assigned as and when required by Senior Student & Academic Services Manager (Academic).
Job Requirements:
• Diploma in Business Administration / relevant discipline
• Preferable with experience in dealing with International Students.

SwimSafer Singapore is looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Part-Time Swimming Coach to join our team. title: Part-time Product Operations Admin Support (Contract)
company_info: We are here to inspire parents to cherish every bonding moment while nurturing their child’s full potential. From our humble beginning in 2017, we have been putting our faith in the magic of parent-child bonding moments. KeaBabies, under our parent company KeaWorld, is now simplifying the lives of over 2.5 million parents in 13 countries. We are well on our way towards an ecosystem that offers a wide range of award-winning and internationally certified baby and maternity products.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Overview
As a part-time Product Operations Coordinator, you will play a valuable role in supporting administrative and operational functions within the product development team. Your responsibilities will focus on documentation, file management, and facilitating collaboration among cross-functional teams.

Key Responsibilities
Assist in creating and maintaining detailed product documentation, including product specifications and requirements.
Organise and manage product-related files to ensure easy retrieval and accessibility.
Assist in documentation, ad hoc administrative duties, and data entry.
Document accurate product measurements and specifications and report to team lead.
Ensure product sample and batch consistency for every batch from the suppliers.
Create barcodes and labels for products and maintain the files for factory productions.
Collaborate closely with the product development team and other departments to gather and document product requirements for product listings and images.
Requirements:
Training will be provided.
Must be able to commit at least 3 days a week, up to 5 days.
Office hours: Mondays to Fridays 10am to 6pm (excluding lunch hour)
Competency in software applications like Canva and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate with Chinese-speaking suppliers.
Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to multitask and prioritise tasks efficiently.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and consistently meeting deadlines.
Willingness to perform general administrative duties as assigned.
In this dynamic part-time role, your contributions will play a vital part in providing administrative and operational support to the product development team, ensuring our products meet specifications and align with organisational goals.

company_info: WHO WE ARE THE WRITER’S PLACE, The Specialist in Creative Writing, is a premium English enrichment centre specializing in English creative writing classes for primary school children in Singapore. Being a pioneer with more than a decade in the industry, we are still strongly committed to helping children gain confidence in English creative writing and performing well in school. As The School of Writing in Singapore, we provide an environment that is specially catered for a community of students to learn the art of English creative writing together! OUR COMMITMENT Our passion in creating opportunities for all children to experience success drives us. This success can be in any form. Indeed, this truly gives us great meaning and purpose in our work for the last 13 years. THE DREAM The dream is to inspire students to see beyond their grades in school and see the value in the ability to express themselves in the written form.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Staff at The Writer's Place enjoy:
Fresh Grads welcome, Training provided, Career advancement
Your contribution matters! Plenty promotion opportunities
Bonus upon completion of 1 year contract till Dec 2024
WE ARE ON THE HUNT TO WELCOME THE BEST CANDIDATES TO JOIN OUR TEAM AS ENGLISH TEACHERS for Pri 1-6! (Contract & Part-time)

The Writer’s Place is The School of Writing in Singapore since 2009
An enrichment centre established since 2009 for primary school students to learn the art of English creative writing. Being a pioneer with more than a decade in the industry, we are still strongly committed to helping children gain confidence in English creative writing and performing well in school!

Position: English & Writing Teacher Specialist (Primary school)
Our teachers are absolutely the champions of our students who respect and support every child in their classes. They are determined to provide young children who enter our School of Writing with opportunities to experience success as confident writers.


Job Description:
Teach English Creative Writing (Primary)
Implement standardized proprietary curriculum to help students perform well in school.
Take pride in keeping track of your students’ progress and development, and are self-motivated to go the extra mile to support those who need it.
Build good rapport with students, as well as their parents.

Our ideal teacher is/has:
A confident communicator
Fun, and able to make lessons enjoyable
Teaching experience is preferred (Training is provided)
A teaching diploma/Bachelor's degree/Post graduate diploma/Professional degree

ABLE TO WORK tuition centre operation hours ie. Weekday nights and Saturday
Tuesday- Friday (12.15pm-8.45pm) Saturday (8.15am-5.00pm)
Closed: Sun, Mon & PH
Sundays are non-working days which is rare for the tuition industry

Various Centre Locations:
Junction 10 (opp. Bukit Panjang MRT)
Woodlands Galaxy CC (5 min walk from Admiralty MRT)

Job Benefits for 1 year contract position
Bonus upon completion of 1 year contract till Dec 2024
Medical & Dental
Positive work culture
Work-life balance
Centre holidays on top of annual leave
Management support to develop meaningful & valuable skill sets in the classroom and beyond
Average staff turnover rate: 3 to 8 years. We are a happy team!

Excellent career progression
To Senior Teacher, Head Teacher and management executive positions

Centre Manager, Customer Service Associate, Receptionist (Full-time/ Part-time positions available)

Responsibilities:

3. To assist plan, prepare and produce materials, and conduct routines and activities with the students pertaining to physical exercises, life-skills training, activities of daily living (ADLs), hobby development (e.g. music, horticulture), and excursions according to the schedule

5. Strong interest and commitment in working with individuals with special needs (e.g. Autism Spectrum Disorder, Intellectual Disability)

9. Attractive staff benefits

10. Singaporeans only

title: IT Support
company_info: Commonwealth Capital Pte Ltd (CCPL) is a Singapore-based investment company with a F&B portfolio from end-to-end manufacturing, logistics to retail services. Focusing on the food vertical value chain, CCPL portfolio of companies engage in in-house production of meat, seafood, bakery, ready-to-eat products, operate state-of-the-art warehousing and logistics services for food retailers and manages over 150 retail points in 12 countries. Its key management team have won multiple business awards and possesses deep knowledge and extensive experience in building brands, operating franchises and providing supply chain management services across regional, pan Asian and Middle-Eastern markets. CCPL is one of Singapore’s most successful home-grown conglomerates. The Group employs more than 1,200 employees and aims to grow its food business aggressively over the next five years.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose

This position will provide IT support, and participate in IT projects, special projects and initiatives that align with and support organizational strategies and business needs.
The successful candidate will assist and be involved in the timely execution and continual management of core IT processes.

Role and Responsibilities
Manage Network accounts to ensure that appropriate levels of network access are allocated and complied with the appropriate standards and protocols
Collect and collate data to produce network traffic reports for the purpose of planning changes in the network
Create a secure networking environment by monitoring and reporting security breaches and any unauthorised data access
Identify, analyse and solve network problems to improve levels of service
Perform 1st level support and troubleshooting for IT infrastructure and application
Develop and maintain IT-related documentation
Perform housekeeping of IT related equipment
Key Competencies
Diligent, meticulous with an eye for details, with minimal supervision
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Good Microsoft Office skills
Qualifications and Experience
NITEC/Higher NITEC with IT specialty
Part time students currently pursuing a Diploma in Infocomm & Security or any other IT-related discipline are welcome to apply
IT support and troubleshooting experience will be advantageous
6 months/1 year contract available, 5 days work week (negotiable if required)
Able to start immediately

title: GEP English Teacher (Primary School)
company: THINK ACADEMY INTERNATIONAL EDUCATION PTE. LTD.
company_info: TAL Education Group (NYSE: TAL) is an education technology (Ed-Tech) company that operates based on Smart Education that provides an open platform for quality education and extra-curricular learning. It serves public education, powers private education, and explores new education models for the future on a global scale. Our mission is Advancing Education Through Science and Technology. Currently there are more than 4 million students every week on TAL’s online and offline education platforms. Think Academy (www.thinkAcademy.sg) is a 100% owned subsidiary of TAL Education Group, recently established to provide K-12 extra-curricular learning services through technology in Singapore. We offer accelerated math learning. Think Academy fosters children’s ability to think critically, strengthens their logic skills, and helps them fulfill their goals through innovative teaching techniques.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Think Academy Singapore is part of the TAL Education Group, one of the largest the leading Edtech company that focuses on online enrichment education, listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE). We are looking for a Gifted Education Programme (GEP) teacher who has solid and stunning experience in GEP English to join our dynamic team to strengthen our GEP product line.

What you'll be involved in:
Plan and deliver engaging and well-paced GEP English lessons, contribute to improving curriculum, pedagogy, and assessment to enhance teaching and learning within the school
Implement appropriate modes of assessment to monitor student progress by providing accurate feedback and implementing suitable instructional supports to close gaps
Communicate with the parents to update the student's learning progression and provide professional advice on a future improvement plan
Your must-haves/ should-haves:
A diploma, bachelor or postgraduate certificate for English, Education, Language or other related areas
Passion for teaching and interest in English course product design (eg, curriculums/ webinars/subject activities)
Previous experience in teaching English is a must
Experience in teaching GEP English or NIE-trained teachers will be an advantage
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Conversational Mandarin is preferred as you may need to communicate with Chinese-speaking parents
Willing to step out of the comfort zone. Eager to learn new things and personal development
Working arrangement: either Full-Time/ Part-Time; open to working during weekday evenings and weekends
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted within two weeks of your application.

title: PART TIME WEEKEND SWIM COACH / SWIM TEACHER - *TRAINING PROVIDED, Min 1 stroke*
company: APS SWIM SCHOOL SINGAPORE PTE LTD
company_info: APS SWIM SCHOOL SINGAPORE PTE LTD Qualifications for Head Age Group Coach: 5 years or more competitive coaching with a minimum of 3 years leading high-level age group swimmers. History of working successfully with head coach in developing competitive, high-performance swimmers and successfully progressing them from an age group program to the national level. Experience with Team Unify and Meet Manager preferred 4. Development of the boy’s and girl’s swim team; planning of training sessions, instruct swimmers on swimming technique, scheduling competitions, monitoring budgets, establish effective communication with team and staff members. 5. Assist in creating seasonal, weekly, and daily practice to include aquatic and dry-land training 6. Coordinate with other coaches to ensure proper athlete development over a long term timeline 7. Recruit prospective student-athletes that meet the academic profile of the club. 8. Assist in parent communication for all matters related to training and swimmers’ physical/mental development 9. Work with athletes on: Goal setting, nutrition, mental preparation, understanding long-term development and planning, etc. 10. Manage athletes’ meet entries 11. Supervise athletes at competitions, including general warm-up, specific race warm-up/warm-down, race preparation and race analysis 12. Assist with developing various camp offering including creating groups, developing programming, identifying and booking venues for activities 13. Coach various summer camp groups of all ages and ability levels Salary: SGD3500
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements
Love the water and have a passion for teaching children? We are hiring Part Time Swim Coach / Swim Teacher (Weekends) ! Join us and be part of the APS Team!
Our Mantra: We hire the character and attitude!
*No prior teaching experience required, as long as you know at least 1 stroke and is water safe!
Swim Teacher Training will be provided with NO additional Costings.*

Earn as You Learn!

JOB RESPONSILIBILITIES
Teaching of APS Swim School Curriculum
Communication with parents on the learning progress of the child
Ensure safety of the children during lesson
Be consistent in attendance
BENEFITS
3 Months In-house Swim Teaching Training program provided
Salary : Different Tiers - Trainee / Junior Swim Teacher / Senior Swim Teacher
Career Advancement: Graders / Deck Operation Officers (Different salary tier)
Rate per hour: $20-$40
Attractive Crew Welfare: Long Year Service Award, annual dinners, team-building activities and many more!
Social & Fun Working Environment
REQUIREMENTS
Enjoy interacting with children
Good communication skills
Friendly Personality
All are welcome to apply
Able to commit weekly on the weekend - Sat AM / Sat PM / Sun AM / Sun PM (at least 1 session)
Place of work near Buona Vista MRT or One North MRT
*No prior teaching experience required as training will be provided.
ONLY SHORT-LISTED CANDIDATES WILL BE NOTIFIED **VIA EMAIL**

title: Digital Marketing Interns (3~6 Months duration starting from Nov / Dec 2023)
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for 1~3 digital Marketing Interns Part or Full-time (3~6 Months duration starting from Nov/Dec 2023) to help us with the following.

*Poly/Private Diploma students and Fresh graduates with relevant qualifications are welcome to apply!

*Current students or undergraduates welcome! Work from Home arrangement so minimal disruption to study schedule!

*1~3 Part-time & full-time internship positions available!

Responsibilities:
· Develop and execute highly engaging digital campaigns to drive traffic and improve revenue on our website and retail stores
· Drive strategic development of customer journey planning, audience segmentation, marketing technology stack, media planning and buying strategies on Facebook, Google and other online channels.
· Familiar with analytics and reporting. Be able to develop marketing success criteria/framework to track goals on a regular basis.
· Evaluate & Report on funnel conversion, repeat and penetration rates, and engagement metrics.

Requirements:
· A Team-player with organizational and time management skills to meet deadlines.
· Hands on experience with Facebook and Google marketing
· Have basic design skills for creating social media marketing content
· Familiar with social media content creation
· Highly motivated individual willing to be flexible and adapt to changing requirements when needed
· Bonus if you have experience doing the following but not absolute requirements.
writing your own blogs
managing your own social media channels.
Creating your own content for FaceBook/Youtube/ Instagram /Tiktok or other social media channels.

title: Beverage Assistant cum Barista
company_info: URBAN GROUP PTE. LTD. An established group operating 2 outlets in Singapore: Contemporary Melting-pot & Bar | CM-PB @ Dempsey The Coastal Settlement | TCS @ Netheravon Road, Changi
employment_type: Part Time, Permanent, Full Time, Flexi-work
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Beverage Assistant (Barback) cum Barista will assist in barista duties, cleaning the bar, preparing garnishes, ensuring the bar is well stocked with napkins, straws, glassware, garnishes, and all other necessities, and taking on other duties to support the Bartender and ensure that the bar operates smoothly.
You should be knowledgeable about menu items, attentive, and focused on providing the best possible service in a fast-paced environment.
To be a successful Bar Back, you should be passionate about working as part of a team to deliver excellent drinks and service to customers. You should be efficient, reliable, and perceptive with excellent communication and time management skills.

5 days work week available: Mondays to Fridays OR Weekdays x 2 rest days - Salary package will differ.
44 hours per week, Overtime available.
Permanent Part-time position available from $12-$18/hr (min. 3 days per week)

Whatsapp to 92301212 to enquire, quote MCF-BT

Woking location: Dempsey

Responsibilities include:
Assisting with opening and closing duties, such restocking the bar with garnishes, straws, and napkins, ensuring that Bartenders have clean towels, glassware, etc.
Ensuring bar is well-stocked with ice, liquor, wine, and beer.
Checking taps and appliances to confirm that they are working properly, making minor repairs or changing out kegs, if needed.
Keeping the bar clean by wiping down surfaces, sweeping and mopping, removing soiled glassware, scrubbing coolers and storage areas, and emptying trash receptacles.
Learning about menu items and memorizing cocktail recipes.
Taking orders, preparing drinks, bussing tables, opening tabs, and processing payments especially during peak hours.
Barista duties, including maintaining the coffee machine & grinder, and other related tools.
Speaking to customers, answering questions, handling complaints.
Maintain records and report levels of usage to assist in reordering process and ensuring that delivered items are stored properly.

title: Therapeutic Care Worker (Youth Mentor)
company_info: We run four programmes working with various vulnerable populations: HCSA Highpoint We provide a safe and substance-free place for homeless male ex-offenders, newly-released prisoners and those in recovery from addiction, to restart their lives. Through a transitional living programme, HCSA Highpoint empowers residents to attain more permanent housing, gainful employment and financial independence, so as to live a productive and addiction-free life, and successfully reintegrate into society. HCSA Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre We offer a caring, safe and therapeutic environment to help teenage girls who have suffered the complex trauma of physical, sexual or emotional abuse. Through the application of certified clinical therapy sessions, we strive to help these girls become healthy individuals who can successfully reintegrate into their schools, families and society. HCSA Dayspring SPIN (Single Parents Informed, Involved, Included) We aim to support caregiving and improve the quality of life for single parents or lone caregivers who lack, or have limited, emotional, physical or practical support. We provide easy access to resources through an ally network of volunteers and an interactive website empowering single parents or lone caregivers to make informed decisions and strngthen their social support network. HCSA Academy We offer a six-week course based on the Food Services SKills framework by SkillsFuture Singapore, culminating in the highly coveted WSQ Higher Certificate in Food Services (Culinary Arts). We aim to equip HCSA's beneficiaries and other vulnerable individuals with the professional skills required for stable employment in the F&B industry, giving them a new lease of life and a level playing field to support themselves and their families.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
ABOUT THE ROLE
Carry out the daily operational duties and supervise residents in their regular activities
Assist residents with any difficulties related to day-to-day issues at Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre and ensure their welfare and safety
Promote discipline among the residents and be a mentor/role model to them
Assess, respond and handle crises or conflicts
Carry out individual therapeutic interventions based on care plans by treatment team
Participate in providing physical, emotional, spiritual, mental, educational, and social needs of residents
CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS
Pre-Requisite:
Youth Mentors are required to work with young beneficiaries with complex trauma. Suitable for workers with cognitive and emotional maturity
Must be willing to work on 3-shift rotations and over weekend/Public Holidays
Currently pursuing part-time tertiary programme need not apply
Must be able to work with children and teenage girls
Competencies:
GCE 'N' Level, 'O' Level or Polytechnic qualification
No counselling and psychological skills is required for this position
With experience in working with youth at-risk
With basic processing and counselling skills
With knowledge of common issues and disorders that appears in trauma and abuse
Suitable emotional attributes and resilence
Good physical and mental health. Suitable emotional attributes and resilience
Good interpersonal skills to work independently and as a team
Energetic, enthusiastic and positive attitude to life and work
Nurturing yet with clear, consistent and firm boundaries
Work Arrangement - Full -time; Permanent

Workplace - Sixth Avenue

Salary commensurate with experience

Interested applicants are to submit a Job Application Form (downloadable from https://hcsa.org.sg/careers/) with their resume to hr@hcsa.org.sg

Order supplies for project team/office.
Maintain personal, office and jobsite space and filing in a neat and organized manner.
Set up project binders and order project drawings from local printing resources.
Assist project team in the preparation and distribution of project punch lists to venders/subcontractors.
Archive all project documentation according to company and/or client requirement.
Participate in project and/or team meetings as needed.
Assist with daily planning of managers schedules, meetings, interviews and possibly travel (through corporate agency), if assigned.
Assist in the implementation of new procedures as designated by company.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Requirement
NITEC / GCE ‘N’’ / ‘O’ / A’ level or Diploma level and above.
Versed in Microsoft office.
Min 1-2 years of experience.
Experience in M&E environment is preferred.

For complete list of jobs opportunities please visit
Supreme Full Jobs List

The Supreme HR Advisory Pte Ltd | 14C7279
Ong Boon Kiet (Travys) | R22104769
Senior Recruitment Consultant

title: Hall Manager
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Front of House/ Hall Staff:
- Ensure high-quality customer service handling customer enquiries, complaints, and feedback
- Set-up the dining area and service station in preparation for the day’s business.
- Take all guest orders following proper guest serving procedures (QR menu order also available)
- Promptly and correctly deliver all orders to guests
- Perform daily and weekly housekeeping and cleaning duties according to schedules.
- Service Manager/ Supervisor:
* Overseeing the day-to-day operations of the restaurant ensuring smooth functioning of the kitchen, dining area and overall customer service.
* Staff management: Recruiting, training, and supervising restaurant staff, including servers, cooks, and other employees.
* Financial Management: Managing the restaurant's budget, monitoring expenses, and optimizing profitability.
* Inventory Control: Maintaining appropriate inventory levels, managing supplies, and ordering stock as needed.
* Maintaining Records: Keeping accurate records of sales, expenses, and other essential data.
· Back of House/ Kitchen Staff:
- Prepare, cook and plate food according to SOP
- Maintain proper consistency of food quality and safety
- Ensure cleanliness and hygiene in food preparation
- Supervisor:
* Ensure stock, deliveries and wastage are all checked and recorded in line with the restaurant food standards
* Prepare the daily mis-en-place and food productions
* Execute and maintain standard recipes, cooking techniques and presentation to assure consistency
* Ensure that high standards of sanitation, cleanliness and safety are maintained throughout all kitchen areas at all times
* Ensure that food storage areas are maintained in accordance with the kitchen’s hygiene, health and safety policies and procedures
* Monitor Kitchen maintenance and report any defects of operating equipment to the Head Chef
Requirement
* Cooking Korean food experience preferred but not compulsory
* Profound knowledge of customer service and all food and beverage products.
* Micros or other similar POS system knowledge is taken into consideration.
* Fluent English is preferred for Hall staff
* Energetic team player with good communication skills
* We welcome candidates with no experience but are passionate about servicing and have a positive learning attitude (hands-on training will be provided)
Salary:
· Full Time: $2,700 - $4,000 per month (Annual Wage Increase based on performance)

Schedule:
* Full Time: 5 or 5.5 days per week.(40-44 hours) - Open Shift/ Close shift
* Part Time: 5 hrs/day of 5days per week or 9hrs/day of 2-3 days per week
* Weekend / Public Holiday availability
Benefits:
* Incentive/bonus - monthly sales target incentives, monthly punctuality incentives and annual bonus upon KPI performance.Employee training programme
* Employee discount
* Food provided during working hours
* Medical insurance
* 9 to 14 days of Annual Leaves (depending on work experience)
Work Location: Suntec City
Expected Start Date: 10/11/2023

title: Intern (Business Development and M&A Support)
company: SI PARTNERS SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the job
Background
SI Partners is a global M&A advisory and consultancy to creative and digital technology businesses, helping stakeholders to build better businesses and realise equity value.
Working primarily in the marketing and communications, digital consulting, and related technology sectors, we operate across Europe, Asia and North America, from our London, Hong Kong, Shanghai and Singapore hubs.

Our commitment to the intern
Our objective is to recruit an energetic and dynamic intern to support the Managers, Directors and Partners directly in prospecting for potential clients in the APAC region. In exchange, we offer broad experience within an entrepreneurial and friendly work environment.
You will be allocated a direct line manager/mentor to support you throughout your time in the business, with responsibility for your development and ensuring your time with us is a mutual success.

Job Responsibilities
– Proactively researching potential clients for the business across Asia Pacific, within the digital consulting and marketing transformation sub-sectors
– Assisting with analysis of data research on companies in preparation for SI Partners’ marketing event, including:
taking such research to assist with identification of individual contact information (eg email addresses)
input to, and tidying up of existing data information on, CRM platform
– Supporting the client-facing team by assisting on tasks such as analysing companies’ strategic options, drafting of collaterals for transaction processes including teasers and business summaries, and supporting businesses through due diligence.
– Supporting the wider business through taking minutes, office support, assisting preparations for meetings and other tasks around the office.

Requirements
The successful candidate should be a confident individual, with demonstrable financial and analytical skills. They must be able to communicate clearly, with strong written and presentational skills, and be personable, with the ability to create a rapport within the team and with prospective clients.The successful candidate will also need to have good computer and typing skills.

This is a varied role, where the work we entrust you with can differ from day-to-day, so we are looking for someone who is a great ‘all-rounder’. The candidate will need to have a 'can-do' attitude and ability to use their initiative. Good teamwork skills are essential.

You will be studying for, or recently completed, a university degree. A Business/Accounting based course is preferred but not essential.

You will have a high standard of written and spoken English. The successful candidate will be available to work full time across September - December of 2023 (flexible on the start and end date). Part time applicants will not be considered.

If you are interested, please send the resume to adminsg@sipartnersglobal.com
