title: Service Crew / Waiter / Waitress (5 Day Roster)
company_info: Little Farms Singapore’s freshest, natural markets and cafes. Sourcing from the highest quality producers and artisans globally. Here at Little Farms, we are always on the lookout for like-minded people who value providing fresh, whole foods and quality service to our customers. If you're interested to join our team, you may submit your detailed resume with contact information to careers@littlefarms.com. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Visit us at https://littlefarms.com/careers/ for other exciting available roles!
Are you passionate about all natural and organic, great food? We are!

We are Singapore’s favourite neighbourhood grocer, and we source the finest all natural and organic food from farms and artisans from Australia, Europe, United States, Singapore, and many other wonderful locations. Our purpose is to help people live happier and healthier lives and we aspire to be our customers’ first choice for clean, natural, healthy, and delicious food; whether they are buying ingredients in our grocery stores (physical or digital) to prepare an epic feast themselves or simply to enjoy a great meal in one of our café-bistros.

We are a mission driven, fast-growing company. We opened our first store in February 2016 to fill a gap in the market for the type of high quality all-natural food that we would love to feed our own families. With 6 Retail Stores, an E-Commerce platform, 4 Café-Bistros, the Starter Lab Bakery Café, & Bakery Factory, we now have more than 250 team members! We have exciting growth plans, and we are always open for new team members with the same purpose and values we have, to join us on this incredible journey together!

Available Work Locations:
Valley Point
Katong Point
Tanglin Mall
Serangoon Gardens
Role of Service Crew / Service Attendant / Waiter / Waitress:
Warmly welcome and greet our customers to the café / bistro
Will learn to possess good product knowledge and be well-versed in all our menu items served in the café / bistro
Confidently present the menu and propose / upsell different food & beverage choices to our customers
Place orders through the point-of-sale (POS) system and help serve orders to the tables accurately
Assist in clearing and resetting of tables according to hygiene standards and requirements
Maintain a high standard of cleanliness for the service station
Any other ad hoc duties as assigned by the management relating to the service and cleanliness of the café / bistro
*Learning and training opportunities leading to growth and salary increments:
Specialist Promotion to Barista --> Senior Barista --> Head Barista, OR
Specialist Promotion to Bartender --> Senior Bartender --> Head Bartender, OR
Traditional Promotion to Captain --> Supervisor --> Assistant Restaurant Manager --> Restaurant Manager --> F&B Operations Manager
Skills and Abilities:
Capable of providing excellent customer service with a can-do attitude
Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work cohesively with fellow team members as part of a team
Able to work on weekends and public holidays (5-day roster)
Part-Time positions are available as well ($12 to $15 an hour)

title: Admin Officer - General Admin Support
company_info: LA PETITE ECOLE PTE. LTD. La Petite Ecole in Singapore is a French international school, member of French international education group Odyssey, founded and chaired by former Minister for Education Mr Luc Chatel. Since 2012, La Petite Ecole has been offering bilingual teaching of the official French curriculum in French and English alternatively. It currently welcomes children from N1 to P2, extending all the way to P5 in the coming years. Like all schools of the Odyssey group, La Petite Ecole is accredited by the French Ministry of Education and a partner of the Agency for French Education Abroad. It is also registered under the Committee for Private Education in Singapore (#201211760D).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We have a full-time / Part-time Admin Officer position that is likely to be vacant/open, for information only / to be determined.

The Admin Officer provides general admin support in terms of school operations, communications, purchases, organisation of events, and handling the registration and enrolment process.

General Admin Support Duties
Answer the phone or welcome visitors.
Welcome the children from the bus in the morning.
Supervise renovations in school or making purchases for the school.
Participate in some of the team meetings and the school councils, as instructed by the management.
Student Management
Registration: Handle school online registration platform.
Enrolment: Handle the whole enrolment process (carrying out visits with prospects, registration, welcoming, departures, invoicing).
Maintain students’ absence records.
Parents-school Relations
Communicate information to the school’s families via school communication app.
Liaise with the parents’ representatives.
Contract Service and Supplier Management
Be the main contact for the security, school bus, canteen, cleaners, and any other service supplier the school may call for.
Coordinate as needed.
Documentation
Ensure that all important documents and procedures are up to date, as well as all data in LPE registration database,
Translate information and documents into English,
Create and format emails, documents, assessment presentations, in both French and English
Expenses management
Keep an expense report summary up to date, organise the invoices to be paid in a timely manner.
Human Resources Management: assist the Management with diverse HR needs, including leave management.

Events
Organise school outings and events.
Co-organise events between the school and families, such as the end-of-the-year fair, or theme-based morning, 2 to 3 times a year.
Support Communications and Marketing Team as needed, such as taking photos of school events and activities, providing information as required etc.

Any other ad hoc support as required by the School Principal and the Management

Required Qualifications
Minimum 3 years related work experience as an office assistant, office administrator, or handling administrative responsibilities in a related field.
Fluence in English, bilingual in French and English is preferred, but not a must.
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Desired Attributes
Results-driven and resourceful, with a strong affinity for critical thinking, hands-on execution, and problem-solving
Self-directed and able to work without supervision.
Highly organized multi-tasker who works well in a fast-paced environment
Excellent team-player
Dynamic, proactive, diligent
Working Hours
Monday to Thursday: from 8am until 5pm;
Friday: from 8am until 4pm.

title: Art educator
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Customer Service, Education and Training, General Management, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who we are:
We are a group of teachers who were trained in various art disciplines from fine arts to design. Our core believe in the value of art education and the importance of developing aesthetic knowledge among all parents, children, teens and adults.
Art Educator (Full-time / Part-time)
At Artgrain, we believe in providing quality art education for all students to gain mastery in art making, to nurture their creative potential and to cultivate a community of artists & art lovers.
We passionately believe asethetic experiences and enjoyment of the arts is an integral part of a rich and fulfilling life. Our mission is to cultivate this sensitivity and the ability to create art and to enjoy art to all children and adults. An art education is essential and necessary as the process in art is unique and enlarges the capacity of each individual very differently from other discipline.
Educational background
Diploma/Degree in either one of these disciplines; fine arts, visual art, design
Work experience
Teaching experience with an art studio or with no formal teaching experience may apply
Personal
Enjoy sharing and teaching visual arts and is passionate about art-making
Like to work with children, teens, and adults
Communicate well in English
Like to work with a team of art educators and art practitioners
Responsibilities & Duties
The role
You will be required to plan art lessons, prepare art materials related to the lesson and areas of responsibilities includes and not exclusively as mentioned;
Teach and be responsible as an educator to conduct art lessons to children, teens, and adult programs.
Up keeping of teaching resources, planning of lessons and materials including up keeping of the room and art materials within the art room.
Administrative duties to support the teaching and running of the studio, includes work at the reception desk in the studio.
Design and planning of art projects/ planning of art programs
Design work for the school
follow up and feedback to parents
Enjoy art-making and sharing
Working arrangement
Able to work on weekends
How to apply:
Please email CV, portfolio and visual arts / design educational qualifications to artgrainpteltd@gmail.com
Who we are:
Artgrain as an art learning specialisation centre embraces a wide range of art forms, from tradition to avant-garde. We believe in being a key player in cultivating passion in art making, creating artworks and writing about art expressions and art education. Artworks produced by or students are inspired both by current and past artists and artwork.
We fully embrace art learning/practise as a key ingredient for all our students and teachers. Visualisation and actualisation of ideas empower our students as a grain is planted in them weekly to tap on their uniquness and their imagination.

title: Secondary Math Teacher | Semi-flexi WFH | Full-time, Permanent
company_info: The Pique Lab is a premier, fast-growing education centre that is focused on helping kids between the ages of 9 to 14 nurture their love for Science. Our vision is to help students kindle a love for learning and be genuinely interested in the world around them. Over the past 8 years, we have had the privilege of helping more than 10,809 students achieve extraordinary improvements in their Science results using our proprietary learning methodology. We focus on shortening our students’ learning curves massively by helping them identify question types, develop strong thought processes and apply answering techniques. The end result? They enjoy the learning process, develop stronger confidence and become more motivated to do better in Science. We’re fuelled by our mission to create the best learning experience when it comes to Science tuition. Join us if you share the same passion as us to help more children learn Science easier, better & faster. Why Join Us? We have a big, bold goal of helping 25,000 students by the end of 2025. There are exciting growth plans to get there, but we believe that the company can only grow as fast as its people can. That’s why you’ll receive plenty of opportunities to learn and develop professionally. We recognise the work you put in and the results you deliver because our success depends on your impact. We have team members who have been here since the very beginning, and they’ll tell you it’s because we take good care of them. If being part of a dynamic, high-performing team specialised in teaching Science excites you, we want you on our team! What Is It Like To Work With Us? With over 55 team members from 10+ departments, our diverse team works closely with each other to uphold a fantastic experience for parents and students. We trust our team to deliver the best for our students, and we empower them with the tools to do so. We thrive on open communication, and our team members’ views and suggestions shape the future of our work. We are fostering an environment of trust, transparency and collaboration. We believe in sharing best practices with each other and giving our team members opportunities to shine, regardless of your job title or seniority. We are looking for team members who believe in the power of grit and perseverance in achieving their goals. Success isn’t achieved overnight, but we’re all in it together for the ride.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Tired of the incessant amount of administrative tasks and unpaid OTs? Bored of not being able to grow in the direction you aspire?
Ready to refresh and relaunch the next phase of your career trajectory with stability in pay and still work with YOUTHS?
If your answer is a resounding YES, The Pi Lab WANTS you!

Since 2013, we've grown from a pair of co-founders to a diverse team of over 70+ team members across 10 departments and have helped over 10,000 students ace their examinations using our proprietary learning methodology and examination-centric materials. We are often known among parents to be knowledgeable, humorous and caring teachers. (Google us and you'll see plenty of raving reviews of our team.)

We are looking for experienced professionals and passionate Mathematics lovers to join us to bring joy of learning to more children. Who knows? You might be nurturing the next Isaac Newton or Pythagoras!

Come join us and play a pivotal role in our team as we ride this HYPER GROWTH in the Singapore market!

[Your Role]

As part of the Specialist Development Programme, you will be involved in:
Honing Your Craft - Regardless of where you start from, we are here to help you succeed as we continue to exchange pedagogical ideas to enhance our lessons for our children. Notably, no more administrative duty to cloud your passion for teaching!
Sharing Prior Industry Experiences – Our children are always curious about what they see around them. In your classes (online & onsite), you could share your prior industry experiences seamlessly as we continue to develop a holistic development of our students’ learning needs and motivations.
New Opportunities for GROWTH – Instead of meeting meaningless deadlines, we also offer you the opportunity to share your knowledge by writing articles and producing videos. Abundant opportunities exist and we are open to working with you to grow TOGETHER!
[Your Growth]

Your success as a Teaching Specialist means a lot to us.

Understanding and realising your career aspirations would be paramount during your first few months at The Pi Lab! Tapping on your existing work experiences, we hope to work with you to develop YOU and our curriculum robustly in the initial phase.

Whenever we are ready for the next stage, you can look forward to exploring various self-initiated projects (not limited to curriculum) where we'll work closely with you.

[You, Our Ideal Teaching Specialist]

We’d love to have a chat with you if you meet the following criteria:

Required:
Strong Background in Mathematics: You should have a strong understanding in the subject matter - demonstrated at the primary/secondary level and is able to simplify complex Mathematical concepts. Added bonus if you majored in Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering at the university level.
Prior Teaching Experience: You should have some experiences in teaching, not strictly limited to Mathematics - be it commercial experience (e.g. teaching in MOE schools, learning centres or private tuition) OR volunteering experience (e.g. coaching kids in after-school care centres).
Prior Working Experience: You should have less than 7 years of working experience, not limited to sectors requiring the use of Mathematics knowledge.

[Your Welfare]
[Biggest Takeaway] Your Way of Career Progression
Competitive Remuneration, including a base salary (a projection based on your last drawn salary) plus a variable pay (which scales based on your contributions)
Annual Performance Bonus (up to 4 months for TOP performers!)
Medical, Dental & Vision Benefits
Productivity & Tech Benefits (27" Dell Monitor for your WFH set-up, Apple Equipment & Peripherals)
Paid Leaves (including Compassionate Leave!)
Time-off From Work For Errands (especially for our Daddy & Mummy, we understand how you need more time with your children as well!)
Fully-stocked Pantry
Free Meals on selected school holidays and weekends
Company Socials
Work From Home Care Packages

[Take Note]
There're have any part-time positions due to the amount of resources required to groom teachers to excellence.
We are expanding into Mathematics and will continue to deepen our expertise in this area within the next 3 to 5 years. If you're only keen to teach English, we're probably not a good fit for you.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Are you jaded by the incessant amount of administrative tasks you need to handle as a teacher? Do you feel held back in your career as you're unable to grow in the direction you aspire?
Are you ready to refresh and relaunch the next phase of your career trajectory with stability in pay and still work with CHILDREN?
If your answer is a resounding YES, The Pi Lab WANTS you!
[About Our Team]
At The Pique Lab, we’re on a mission to create the best Science learning experience for students aged 9 to 16 in Singapore. Our lessons are meticulously crafted based on pedagogical research, data-driven methodologies and have one overarching goal: to make learning fun, shorten learning curves and help students develop a genuine appreciation for Science.
Over the past decade, we've grown from a pair of co-founders to a diverse team of over 80 team members across 10 departments. Our proprietary learning methodology and examination-centric materials have helped more than 20,000 students ace their Science examinations.
Our headquarters is in Singapore, with additional offices in China, Philippines and Malaysia. We take pride in our open, fast-paced and flat organisational structure where every team member is valued for their skills and competencies, not just their job titles.
We are looking for experienced professionals and passionate Mathematics lovers to join us to bring joy of learning to more children. Who knows? You might be nurturing the next Isaac Newton or Pythagoras!
If you like the prospects of working in a close-knit team, leveraging tech to work hyper-efficiently while tackling challenges head-on, we’d love to talk to you about joining the team!

[Your Role]

title: SEA Operations Coordinator
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB SUMMARY: The Operations Coordinator coordinates the service delivery functions for a specific field office and supports the Director with employee management and administrative oversight.
The SEA Operations Coordinator role is a people focused, hands on, project management role that is constantly evolving, shifting gears and being re-defined. The role requires involvement and management of a myriad of security and risk management projects, from executive protection tasks to fraud investigations to corporate risk management strategy. The successful applicant will have the energy, dedication and capacity to thrive in a dynamic environment, while being an integral part of dedicated team.

Essential Functions:
The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasksmay vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity.
All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions.
Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein.
In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions.
All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives.
The Essential Functions Include:
1. Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
2. Oversee and coordinate scheduling of the security consultants, part time employees, and contractors.
3. Ensure all services are conducted in a timely and professional manner and aligned with Pinkerton's Service Delivery Standards;Assist Director with on-going client service calls.
Address client questions and/or concerns quickly and effectively.
Communicate employee performance concerns and/or status updates to the Director.
4. Serve as the point of contact in support of clients' ongoing projects.
5. Perform various investigative and protective details, as assigned by the Director.
6. Assist with general administrative and operational functions.
7. All other duties, as assigned.
Minimum Hiring Standards:
Additional qualifications may be specified and receive preference, depending upon the nature of the position.
Must have Advanced Level Exams or equivalent qualification.
Must be willing to participate in the Company's pre-employment screening process, including drug testing and/or background investigation.
Must be at least 18 years of age.
Must have a reliable means of communication (i.e., email, cell phone).
Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private).
Must have the legal right to work in the Singapore.
Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English.
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree preferred with at least three years of security operations and/or business management experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.

Competencies (As Demonstrated Through Experience, Training, and/or Testing):
Security operations and/or business management experience.
Experience working in SEA with excellent soft skills / people management.
Able to carry out responsibilities with little or no supervision.
Solid project management skills.
Able to multi-task and organize workload for effective implementation.
Strong client orientation and results driven.
Able to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures.
Serve as an effective team leader.
Able to adapt as the external environment and organization evolves.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Computer skills; Microsoft Office.
Working Conditions (Physical/Mental Demands):
With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to perform effectively all essential functions. In addition to other demands, the demands of the job include:
Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks, controlled ubstance testing, and behavioral selection survey.
Maintain composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff, and the public occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
Exposure to sensitive and confidential information.
Regular computer usage.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly in order to communicate with employees and/or customers.
Manual dexterity required for occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
Close and distance vision and ability to adjust focus.
Frequent sitting, standing, and/or walking.
Travel, as required.
Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.

title: Lower Secondary Science Teacher | Semi-flexi WFH | Full-time, Permanent
company_info: The Pique Lab is a premier, fast-growing education centre that is focused on helping kids between the ages of 9 to 14 nurture their love for Science. Our vision is to help students kindle a love for learning and be genuinely interested in the world around them. Over the past 8 years, we have had the privilege of helping more than 10,809 students achieve extraordinary improvements in their Science results using our proprietary learning methodology. We focus on shortening our students’ learning curves massively by helping them identify question types, develop strong thought processes and apply answering techniques. The end result? They enjoy the learning process, develop stronger confidence and become more motivated to do better in Science. We’re fuelled by our mission to create the best learning experience when it comes to Science tuition. Join us if you share the same passion as us to help more children learn Science easier, better & faster. Why Join Us? We have a big, bold goal of helping 25,000 students by the end of 2025. There are exciting growth plans to get there, but we believe that the company can only grow as fast as its people can. That’s why you’ll receive plenty of opportunities to learn and develop professionally. We recognise the work you put in and the results you deliver because our success depends on your impact. We have team members who have been here since the very beginning, and they’ll tell you it’s because we take good care of them. If being part of a dynamic, high-performing team specialised in teaching Science excites you, we want you on our team! What Is It Like To Work With Us? With over 55 team members from 10+ departments, our diverse team works closely with each other to uphold a fantastic experience for parents and students. We trust our team to deliver the best for our students, and we empower them with the tools to do so. We thrive on open communication, and our team members’ views and suggestions shape the future of our work. We are fostering an environment of trust, transparency and collaboration. We believe in sharing best practices with each other and giving our team members opportunities to shine, regardless of your job title or seniority. We are looking for team members who believe in the power of grit and perseverance in achieving their goals. Success isn’t achieved overnight, but we’re all in it together for the ride.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Are you passionate about inspiring curious minds to love Science while growing in a career that pays you well?
If your answer is a resounding YES, The Pique Lab WANTS you!
[About Our Team]
At The Pique Lab, we’re on a mission to create the best Science learning experience for students aged 9 to 16 in Singapore. Our lessons are meticulously crafted based on pedagogical research, data-driven methodologies and have one overarching goal: to make learning fun, shorten learning curves and help students develop a genuine appreciation for Science.
Over the past decade, we've grown from a pair of co-founders to a diverse team of over 80 team members across 10 departments. Our proprietary learning methodology and examination-centric materials have helped more than 20,000 students ace their Science examinations.
Our headquarters is in Singapore, with additional offices in China, Philippines and Malaysia. We take pride in our open, fast-paced and flat organisational structure where every team member is valued for their skills and competencies, not just their job titles.
We are looking for passionate Science lovers to join us to bring the joy of learning to more children. Who knows? You might be nurturing the next Albert Einstein or Marie Curie!
If you like the prospects of working in a close-knit team, leveraging tech to work hyper-efficiently while tackling challenges head-on, we’d love to talk to you about joining the team!

[Your Role]
As a Primary Science Teacher at The Pique Lab, you will be involved in:
Class & Learning Management – You will manage classes (online & onsite) effectively with a holistic understanding of your students’ learning needs and motivations
Lesson Preparation & Delivery – You’ll prepare for your lessons in accordance to our curriculum. In particular, you’ll devise ways to simplify Science concepts and highlight common misconceptions.
Publishing – You’ll share your knowledge by writing articles and producing videos, so that your students can continue to learn from you outside of the classroom.
Communication – You’ll communicate with parents on their children’s learning progress and make appropriate recommendations on how to improve further.
[Your Growth]
Your success as a Lower Secondary Science Tutor means a lot to us.
Rigorous training is provided during your first 9 months at The Pique Lab, which is aimed at increasing your confidence and expertise as a Primary Science Teacher.
You will start your career with us by undergoing the Teaching Associate Programme where you'll learn plenty of valuable teaching skills:
Content Mastery: Solidify your fundamentals in the Primary Science syllabus by learning key concepts & examination question types. Understand how to apply a variety of answering techniques to tackle questions effectively.
Attention Control: Discover how to make your lessons come alive, such that your students never get bored of them. Dive deep into delivery technicals such as coherency, clarity, tempo, gestures, expression and humour.
Class Control: Pick up effective classroom management strategies, so that you're able to maintain a fun, yet disciplined teaching approach with your students.
Performance Management: Learn how to use cues effectively to instil a stronger sense of confidence in your students & help them develop a stronger affinity for Science.
Communicating With Parents: Understand how to communicate with parents, such that they are supportive and appreciative of your work.
After you've achieved mastery in your fundamentals, you can look forward to explore various career pathways (Specialist Track & Management Track) where we'll work closely with you to spearhead projects or manage teams.

[You, Our Ideal Candidate]
We’d love to have a chat with you if you meet the following criteria:
Required:
Strong Background in Science: You should have a strong understanding in the subject matter - not just at the university level, but at a primary/secondary level, and hence be able to simplify complex Science concepts.
Prior Teaching Experience: You should have some experience in teaching, not strictly limited to Science - be it commercial experience (e.g. teaching in MOE schools, tuition centres or private 1-1 classes) OR volunteering experience (e.g. coaching kids in after-school care centres).
Good to have:
A Positive, Confident & Engaging Personality: You need to be comfortable engaging students at a group level & infuse joy and laughter in your lessons.
Grit and Drive to Succeed: You must be committed to mastery and be willing to put in the hard work. You should have a clear idea on what you intend to pursue in your career, at least for the next 3 to 5 years,
Ability to learn fast and think on your feet: You will be expected to pick up and apply strategies and techniques taught to you quickly, especially during the training period.

[Your Welfare]
[Biggest Takeaway] Mentorship, Training & Regular Feedback
Abundant Career Progression Opportunities in two different tracks: Specialist track and Management track
Competitive Remuneration, including a base salary (starting from $3,400/ month) plus a variable pay (which scales based on your contributions)
Annual Performance Bonus
Medical, Dental & Vision Benefits
Technology Benefits
Paid Leaves
Time-off From Work For Errands
Fully-stocked Pantry
Free Meals on selected school holidays and weekends
Company Socials
Work From Home Care Packages

[Take Note]
We respect your time commitment with us. As such, you'll be paid full salary, even during your training period.
There are no part-time teaching positions due to the amount of resources required to groom teachers to excellence.
We specialise only in Primary Science and will continue to deepen our expertise in this area within the next 3 to 5 years. If you're only keen to teach Mathematics or English, we're probably not a good fit for you.

title: Assistant Director of F&B (GCW)
company_info: MILLENNIUM & COPTHORNE INTERNATIONAL LIMITED
address: GRAND COPTHORNE WATERFRONT HOTEL, 392 HAVELOCK ROAD 169663
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Financial
To co-ordinate with all outlet managers a flexible work force using principles of multi-skilling and multi-tasking to ensure maximization of resource allocation.
To ensure that each All F&B outlet is managed successfully as an independent profit center.
To ensure that each outlet is managed by the Outlet Manager and Head Chef who are totally accountable for their profitability.
To set, in close conjunction with each Outlet Manager, annual operating budgets which will form part of the Hotel's annual business plan.
To monitor all costs and recommend measures to control them. To establish together with the cost controller an integrated cost management plan through streamlining of products, minimal inventories and joint procurement with sister hotels to achieve economies of scale.
To ensure that the department operational budget is strictly adhered to.
To monitor all costs and recommend / institute measures to control them.
To prepare accurate monthly forecasts on covers, average check, revenue and expenses and schedule resources.
To prepare All F&B outlets capital expenditure plan annual together with the Executive Chef.
Operational
To ensure that all the outlets are managed efficiently according to the established concept statements and adhere to Company and Hotel Policies & Procedures.
·To implement a flexible employee base, with the right mix of full time and part time employees. To allocate employees over the department based on established business levels for the day.
To assign responsibilities to subordinates and to check their performance periodically.
To represent the F&B Department on the HOD Committee.
To support staff needs in other departments based on the hotel priorities and anticipated business levels.
To monitor service and food and beverage standards in all outlets. To work with the Outlet Managers and respective Head Chefs to take corrective action where necessary.
To be available and on duty during peak periods and practice hands on management style.
To conduct frequent and thorough kitchen inspections together with the Executive Chef of the F&B operations.
To handle guest and employee inquiries in a courteous and efficient manner and report guest complaints or problems to supervisors if no immediate solution can be found and assure service recovery with guests. These incidents are to be logged in the GIF forms and kept in file.
Guest Service
To establish good rapport with guests maintaining good customer relationship and handle all guest complaints, requests and enquiries of food, beverage and service.
To personally and frequently verify that guests in all the outlets are receiving the best possible service.
To spend time in the outlets (during peak periods) to ensure that the outlets are managed well by the respective outlet team and functions to the fullest expectations.
To be demanding and critical when it comes to service standards.
To ensure that the All outlet team projects a warm, professional and welcome image and that the 3 service basics are performed (warm welcome, anticipation of guests’ needs and requests and service with a smile).
Create an atmosphere in all event management operations areas that meets or exceeds guest expectations.
Sets a positive example for guest relations.
Interact with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels.
Respond to and handles guest problems and complaints.
Empower employees to provide excellent customer service.
Ensure employees understand expectations and parameters.
Strives to improve service performance.
Emphasizes guest satisfaction during all departmental meetings and focuses on continuous improvement.
F&B Product
To frequently verify that only fresh products are used in food and beverage preparation and that hygiene standards are in compliance with regulatory requirements.
To frequently taste food and beverage in all outlets and be demanding and critical when it comes to food and beverage quality and consistency.
To encourage the Executive Chef to be creative and ensure that he operates well as a key member of the team.
To encourage creativity among the outlet teams.
To communicate daily with the Executive Chef to ensure that the buffet displays are of the highest quality and visually appealing.
To focus on upselling program to optimize revenue in all outlets.
Administration
To ensure that all departmental operations manual are prepared and updated annually.
To ensure that all Food & Beverage forms and reports by the Outlet Managers are forwarded in time to the F&B Office.
To conduct monthly Food & Beverage Meeting.
To ensure that all meetings are well planned, efficient and results oriented.
To conduct daily operations briefing with all Outlet Managers.
To ensure that deadlines on all projects are met.
Marketing
To prepare with the respective outlet teams, a yearly marketing plan for each outlet, which is the basis of the Food & Beverage Annual Marketing Plan.
To continuously seek ways to assist the outlet management maximize their revenues and profits.
To monitor and analyze the activities and trend of competitive restaurants and bars.
To ensure that all outlet management teams are fully aware of market needs and trends and that their products meet these requirements.
To ensure that a Profit and Loss Analysis is determined before committing to any Food & Beverage Promotion and that all Outlet Managers prepare a post-mortem after each and every promotion.
General
To understand and strictly adhere to the Rules & Regulations and Hotel's policy on Fire, Hygiene, Health and Safety.
To report for duty punctually wearing smart attire according to hotel's dress codes and name badge at all times.
To maintain a high standard of personal appearance and hygiene at all times.
To maintain a good rapport and working relationship with staff in the outlet and all other departments.
To attend and contribute to all staff meeting and departmental and hotel training as scheduled and other related activities.
To undertake any reasonable tasks and secondary duties as assigned by the General Manager.
To respond to any changes in the F&B Department function as dictated by the hotel.
To project at all times a positive and motivated attitude and exercise self-control.
To have a complete understanding of the Hotel's Policies and Procedures.
To provide a courteous and professional service at all times.
Training and Employee Relations
To recruit and select and train F&B outlet Managers, Assistant Managers and supervisory employees who are able to work within the guidelines and principles as set out in the Food and Beverage operations manual. To ensure that all employees go through the orientation induction process.
To ensure that each outlet manager plans and implements effective training programs for their staff with the Training Manager and Departmental Trainers.
To assist in the building of an efficient team of employees through Multi Skilling, Multi-Tasking and flexible scheduling and by taking an active interest in their welfare, safety and development.
To develop departmental trainers, assign training responsibilities and meet with departmental trainers monthly.
To conduct yearly performance appraisal and give employees regular feedback on their job performance.
To ensure that all employees in the F&B Department participate in the Employee Opinion Survey which is conducted annually.
To ensure that all employees report for duty punctually wearing the correct uniform and name badge at all time.
To ensure that all employees provide a courteous and professional service at all times.
To ensure that all employees have a complete understanding of and adhere to the rules and regulations and adhere to the hotel's policy relating to Fire, Hygiene, Health and Safety.
To ensure that all annual leave / public holidays is planned effectively so that all leave will be cleared in the current working year.
To ensure that staff at all levels of the Food & Beverage department is familiar with the Hotel's core values and guiding principles and actively participates in the shared vision of success.
Sales
Aggressive involves initiation and development of quality leads to ensure growth of banquet sales both in-house and outside catering.
Develop existing business and solicit new catering business through catering lead generation and catering sales marketing. Solicits new catering customers through traditional and non-traditional sales techniques.
Managing Profitability
Assist in developing working relationships with outside vendors and establishing prices and service agreements to enhance the event experience and to increase additional revenue opportunities for the property as needed.
Create opportunities to upsell during event planning.
Assist in managing department controllable expenses to achieve or exceed budgeted goals.

Minimum certificate in Hotel Management or F&B Management.
Minimum 6 - 8 years in a supervisory role in hotels F&B outlets.
Preferably attained WSQ Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedure certificate.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Looking for a different kind of part time or full time service role that's actually FUN?

And with a pretty cool job title: Game Master!

We are currently hiring part-time and full time staff who are excited about escape rooms (and horror / thriller themes in general). You'll be working in a tightly knit fun team to provide the following to our wonderful customers:

- Greet customers and assist them with bookings on site and via phone calls
- Conduct an engaging briefing of game rules and back story of the games customers are playing
- Assist customers with hints during the game and prompting them with clues for them to progress to the next stage
- Cashiering duties
- Staging the games by resetting after each game and sanitising the common touch points
- To provide immaculate service while watching the games to ensure customers are safe and playing the games correctly
- Basic housekeeping of the shop
- Opening and closing of the shop
- Checking of gadgets and props to ensure games run smoothly


Here's what we're looking for in an outstanding individual to join our awesome team:
1. Reliable and responsible with good ethics
2. Energetic and enjoys interacting with customers
3. Meticulous
4. Loooooves horror, or at least is not afraid of horror themes
5. Able to work until 11pm during busy periods
6. Has good initiative
7. Able to facilitate groups of all ages and variety in number of pax
8. Able to multitask and take the lead
9. Fluently spoken in English and bilingual is a plus
10. Able to commit 2 to 3 days a week for a minimum period of 3 months

Location: The Centrepoint (Somerset MRT)

Salary: $7 to $10.50 per hour and above for part timers. We expedite increments, even for part timers who perform well.

Incentives and over time pay will be provided.

Working Hours: Morning shift: 10.30am to 5pm Afternoon shift: 5pm to 10pm or closing, For late games that ends past 11pm, we do provide transport allowances.

Benefits: Career growth for senior roles/ managerial roles, including for part-timers. We also give out incentives and over time pay.

Interested candidates, please send in your resume and a recent photo to corporate(at)trapped.sg
We look forward to hear from you!

title: Freelance ICT Trainer
company_info: AIMS (Asia Innovatory Management School) is an industry expert in Recruitment, Management as well as ICT Services. AIMs has been in this industry for the past 12 years since 2008. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About ACP
ACP is the leading provider of Learning Management System - LMS, E-learning, Website Development and ICT Solutions. In our current day and age, the evolution and adoption of technology in jobs worldwide have enabled us to streamline job processes and increase organizational efficiency as we receive instantaneous information from the web. As such, digital literacy is a crucial skill that must be imparted to the next generation. We strive to embrace technology to empower every individual to learn in our borderless world.
Job Summary:
Keen on making a difference where it counts?
As a part-time Trainer, that’s exactly what you’ll be doing! With flexible working hours, a highly competitive salary, and minimal working experience required, you’ll be tasked with providing and delivering IT training to students in our local schools!
Expert training is provided to ensure that you start off with the right skills necessary, but if you’ve got good communication and IT skills, an open mindset, and enjoy teaching and working with children, you’re definitely someone we’re looking for!
Job Description
1. Conduct software training for students in school in 3 main areas: Cybersecurity, Analytics and Mobile App.
Cybersecurity:
Raise awareness about primary school students on the importance of cybersecurity in a fun and engaging manner
Engage students in project work on real encryption algorithm
Aspire students to adopt cyber hygiene practices and share cybersecurity tips with their loved ones
Analytics:
Generate interests among secondary and junior college students on the basic concepts of Data Analytics
Exposed secondary and Junior College students to the fundamentals of data analysis like data gathering and data mining
Guide secondary and junior college students on the application of data analysis tools in interesting project themes like World Cup 2022
Mobile App:
Introduce programming technologies and design tools on mobile applications to students
Guide students in the creation of their very own mobile app through the script-based programming-based tool, Ionic
Assist students in understanding how data collected from their app can be visualised, analysed and presented using a data analytics visual representation software
Job Requirements:
IT background and someone registered with MOE
IT savvy and able to pick up new software very quickly
Good verbal and written communication skills, proactive with good working attitudes
Candidates should have at least 6 months of working experience in teaching in ICT.
Details:
Project based part-time assignment
Working hours: Flexible hours in both morning and afternoons, after official school hours
Remuneration: $15-$50/hr
Remuneration depends on the candidate's working experiences in ICT Training.

title: Customer Service Crew cum Cashier (CAKE SHOP)
company_info: Whimsically named after a stop on London’s Northern Tube Line, Chalk Farm was founded in late 2010. Back then, the company’s presence was strictly online. Specialising in unfussy but elegant cakes, there were just two on the menu: a carrot whiskey sultana and a deep, dark gingerbread, both of which were highly popular during Christmas time. Other cakes were gradually incorporated into the collection, such as salted caramel macadamia cupcakes, a chocolate guinness cake, a red velvet with its roof of raspberries, and kueh salaat, a Nyonya delicacy, for which it has become incredibly well known. After three years of courting new ideas and refining old ones, Chalk Farm opened its first outlet in Paragon in 2013 and its second outlet in Parkway Parade in 2014. Both are cosy, clean spaces built around a glass counter, the soul of the shop, housing an manners of sweet offerings, from lemon yoghurt loaves to chocolate olive oil cupcakes, from squidgy brownies to feathery chiffons and with seasonal treats introduced every month.
